member.name: M:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.Refresh
member.summary: Forces the control to invalidate its client area and immediately redraw itself and any child controls. Note however that this method will node do anything if refresh is suspended as result of call to BeginUpdate method without corresponding EndUpdate call or if SuspendPaint property is set to true.

member.name: M:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Disables any redrawing of the tree control. To maintain performance while items are added one at a time to the control, call the BeginUpdate method. The BeginUpdate method prevents the control from painting until the EndUpdate method is called.

member.name: M:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.EndUpdate
member.summary: Enables the redrawing of the tree view. To maintain performance while items are added one at a time to the control, call the BeginUpdate method. The BeginUpdate method prevents the control from painting until the EndUpdate method is called.
member.remarks: Call to EndUpdate will enable the layout and painting in tree control. If there are any pending layouts the EndUpdate will call RecalcLayout method to perform the layout and it will repaint the control.

member.name: M:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.EndUpdate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables the redrawing of the tree view. To maintain performance while items are added one at a time to the control, call the BeginUpdate method. The BeginUpdate method prevents the control from painting until the EndUpdate method is called.
member.param: Gets or sets whether layout and refresh of control is performed if there are no other update blocks pending.

member.summary: Retrieves the tree node that is at the specified location.
member.returns: The Node at the specified point, in tree view coordinates.

remarks.para: You can pass the MouseEventArgs.X and MouseEventArgs.Y coordinates of the MouseDown event as the x and y parameters.

The Y position to evaluate and retrieve the node from.

Whether to enumerated displayed nodes only.

member.name: M:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.RecalcLayout
member.summary: Applies any layout changes to the tree control.
member.remarks: Layout will not be performed if BeginUpdate is called. Any calls to the RecalcLayout will return without executing requested layout operation.

member.name: M:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.GetLayoutRectangle(System.Drawing.Rectangle)

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AfterCheck
member.summary: Occurs after the cell check box is checked.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.BeforeCheck
member.summary: Occurs before the cell check box is checked and provides opportunity to cancel the event.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AfterCollapse
member.summary: Occurs after the tree node is collapsed.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.BeforeCollapse
member.summary: Occurs before the tree node is collapsed.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AfterExpand
member.summary: Occurs after the tree node is expanded.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.BeforeExpand
member.summary: Occurs before the tree node is expanded.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CommandButtonClick
member.summary: Occurs when command button on node is clicked.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.BeforeCellEdit
member.summary: Occurs before cell is edited. The order of the cell editing events is as follows: BeforeCellEdit, CellEditEnding, AfterCellEdit, AfterCellEditComplete.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CellEditEnding
member.summary: Occurs just before the cell editing is ended. The text box for editing is still visible and you can cancel the exit out of editing mode at this point. The order of the cell editing events is as follows: BeforeCellEdit, CellEditEnding, AfterCellEdit, AfterCellEditComplete.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AfterCellEdit
member.summary: Occurs after cell editing has ended and before the new text entered by the user is assigned to the cell. You can abort the edits in this event. The order of the cell editing events is as follows: BeforeCellEdit, CellEditEnding, AfterCellEdit, AfterCellEditComplete.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AfterCellEditComplete
member.summary: Occurs after cell editing has been completed. This event cannot be canceled.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SelectionChanged
member.summary: Occurs after node selection has changed.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.BeforeNodeSelect
member.summary: Occurs before Node has been selected by user or through the SelectedNode property. Event can be cancelled.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AfterNodeSelect
member.summary: Occurs after node has been selected by user or through the SelectedNode property.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AfterNodeDeselect
member.summary: Occurs after node has been deselected by user or through the SelectedNode or SelectedNodes properties.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.BeforeNodeRemove
member.summary: Occurs before node has been removed from its parent.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AfterNodeRemove
member.summary: Occurs after node has been removed from its parent.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.BeforeNodeInsert
member.summary: Occurs before node is inserted or added as child node to parent node.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AfterNodeInsert
member.summary: Occurs after node is inserted or added as child node.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeDragStart
member.summary: Occurs when node drag & drop operation is initiated.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.BeforeNodeDragStart
member.summary: Occurs before internal node drag & drop support is initiated and allows you to cancel the drag & drop.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.BeforeNodeDrop
member.summary: Occurs before Drag-Drop of a node is completed and gives you information about new parent of the node that is being dragged as well as opportunity to cancel the operation.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeDragFeedback
member.summary: Occurs while node is being dragged. You can handle this event to disable the drop at specific nodes or to even change the drop location for the node by modifying event arguments.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AfterNodeDrop
member.summary: Occurs after Drag-Drop of a node is completed. This operation cannot be cancelled.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeMouseDown
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse pointer is over the node and a mouse button is pressed.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeMouseUp
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse pointer is over the node and a mouse button is released.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeMouseMove
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse pointer is moved over the node.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeMouseEnter
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse enters the node.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeMouseLeave
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse leaves the node.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeMouseHover
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse hovers over the node.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeClick
member.summary: Occurs when the node is clicked with left mouse button. If you need to know more information like if another mouse button is clicked etc. use NodeMouseDown event.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeDoubleClick
member.summary: Occurs when the node is double-clicked.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SerializeNode
member.summary: Occurs after an node has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data associated with the node and load it back up in DeserializeNode event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeNodeEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.DeserializeNode
member.summary: Occurs after an node has been de-serialized (loaded) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrieve any data you saved in SerializeNode event.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.MarkupLinkClick
member.summary: Occurs when hyperlink in text-markup is clicked.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ProvideCustomCellEditor
member.summary: Occurs when cell with custom editor type is about to be edited by user. Handle this event to provide custom editors.

member.summary: Occurs when the DataSource changes.

member.summary: Occurs when the DisplayMembers property changes.

member.summary: Occurs while column is being resized by end-user.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.DisposeNodes
member.summary: Indicates whether nodes are disposed when control is disposed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.DeepSort
member.summary: Indicates whether sorting of node collection sorts child nodes as well. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ShowToolTips
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tooltips are shown when mouse is over the cell when Tooltip property is set.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ColumnHeaderControl
member.summary: Gets the column header control which renderes the columns.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ScrollBarAppearance
member.summary: Gets or sets the scroll-bar visual style.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.TileSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the proposed size of the tile in Tile view. The size of the tile might be larger than specified if Style assigned to node, cells adds padding, margins etc. or if Node.Image or font is greater than width or height specified here.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.HideSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the selected tree node remains highlighted even when the tree control has lost the focus.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.IsKeyboardFocusWithin
member.summary: Gets whether keyboard focus is within the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.EndCellEditingOnLostFocus
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cell editing is completed when control loses input focus. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ContextMenuBar
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference to DotNetBar ContextMenuBar component which is used to provide context menu for nodes. This property is automatically maintained by AdvTree.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.Zoom
member.summary: Gets or sets zoom factor for the control. Default value is 1. To zoom display of the nodes for 20% set zoom factor to 1.2 To zoom view 2 times set zoom factor to 2. Value must be greater than 0. Zoom is supported only when non-column tree setup is used. Please note that Zoom functionality is designed only for very special use cases and only for plain tree control setup which does not use editing, alternating row colors, drag & drop or any other advanced functionality.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.TreeSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the tree.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeRenderer
member.summary: Gets or sets custom node renderer. You can set this property to your custom renderer. When set the RenderMode should be set to Custom to enable your custom renderer. To choose one of the system renderer use RenderMode property. Default value is null.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.RenderMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the render mode used to render all nodes. Default value is eNodeRenderMode.Default which indicates that system default renderer is used. Note that if you specify custom renderer you need to set AdvTree.NodeRenderer property to your custom renderer.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.BackgroundStyle
member.summary: Gets the style for the background of the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CellHorizontalSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets internal layout cell horizontal spacing. This property is for advanced internal use and you should not set it.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.DragDropEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether automatic drag and drop is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether anti-alias smoothing is used while painting the tree.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.PathSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets the delimiter string that the tree node path uses.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AllowUserToResizeColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets whether user can resize the columns. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AllowUserToReorderColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets whether user can reorder the columns. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.Columns
member.summary: Gets the collection of column headers that appear in the tree.

remarks.para: By default there are no column headers defined. In that case tree control functions as regular tree control where text has unrestricted width.
If you want to restrict the horizontal width of the text but not display column header you can create one column and set its width to the width desired and set its Visible property to false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ColumnsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether column headers are visible if they are defined through Columns collection. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.Styles
member.summary: Gets the collection of all style elements created for the tree.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CellStyleDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets default style for the node cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CellStyleMouseDown
member.summary: Gets or sets default style for the node cell when mouse is pressed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CellStyleMouseOver
member.summary: Gets or sets default style for the node cell when mouse is over the cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CellStyleSelected
member.summary: Gets or sets default style for the node cell when cell is selected.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CellStyleDisabled
member.summary: Gets or sets default style for the node cell when cell is disabled.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeStyleExpanded
member.summary: Gets or sets default style for the node when node is expanded.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets default style for all nodes where style is not specified explicity.
member.value: Name of the style assigned or null value indicating that no style is used. Default value is null.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeStyleSelected
member.summary: Gets or sets style for the node when node is selected. Note that this style is applied to the default node style.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned or null value indicating that no style is used. Default value is null.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeStyleMouseOver
member.summary: Gets or sets style for the node when mouse is over node. Note that this style is applied to the default node style.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned or null value indicating that no style is used. Default value is null.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.Nodes
member.summary: Gets the collection of tree nodes that are assigned to the tree view control.
member.value: A NodeCollection that represents the tree nodes assigned to the tree control.

remarks.para: The Nodes property holds a collection of Node objects, each of which has a Nodes property that can contain its own NodeCollection.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical spacing between nodes in pixels. Default value is 3.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeHorizontalSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal spacing between nodes in pixels when control is in Tile layout. Default value is 4.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.GridRowLines
member.summary: Gets or sets whether horizontal grid lines between each row are displayed. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.GridColumnLineResizeEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether column can be resized when mouse is over the column grid line and outside of the column header. GridColumnLines must be set to true to make column lines visible.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.GridColumnLines
member.summary: Gets or sets whether grid lines are displayed when columns are defined. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.GridLinesColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the grid lines color.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AlternateRowColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the alternate row color applied to every other row. Default value is Color.Empty.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodesColumnsBackgroundStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the background style for the child nodes columns. Background style defines the appearance of the column header background.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned to the column header.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ColumnsBackgroundStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the background style for the columns. Background style defines the appearance of the column header background.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned to the column header.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ColumnStyleNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets the default style class assigned to the column headers.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned to the column header.
member.remarks: When style is not set on ColumnHeader objects then style setting from this property is used instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ColumnStyleMouseDown
member.summary: Gets or sets default style class assigned to the column which is applied when mouse button is pressed over the header.
member.value: Name of the style assigned to the column.
member.remarks: When style is not set on ColumnHeader objects then style setting from this property is used instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ColumnStyleMouseOver
member.summary: Gets or sets default style class assigned to the column which is applied when mouse is over the column.
member.value: Name of the style assigned to the column.
member.remarks: When style is not set on ColumnHeader objects then style setting from this property is used instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.Headers
member.summary: Gets collection that holds definition of column headers associated with nodes.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SelectedNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the tree node that is currently selected in the tree control.

remarks.para: If no Node is currently selected, the SelectedNode property is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SelectedNodes
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of currently selected nodes in tree control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.MultiSelect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether multi-node selection is enabled. Default value is false. When multi-selection is enabled use SelectedNodes property to retrive collection of selected nodes. Use MultiSelectRule property to change the multi-node selection rule.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.MultiSelectRule
member.summary: Gets or sets the rule that governs the multiple node selection. Default value indicates that only nodes belonging to same parent can be multi-selected.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeLayout
member.summary: Returns reference to node layout object.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodeDisplay
member.summary: Returns reference to node display object.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.IsUpdateSuspended
member.summary: Gets whether layout is suspended for tree control. Layout is suspended after call to BeginUpdate method and it is resumed after the call to EndUpdate method.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.IsLayoutPending
member.summary: Gets whether control has layout operation pending on next paint or update.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SuspendPaint
member.summary: Gets or sets whether paint operations are suspended for the control. You should use this method if you need the RecalcLayout operations to proceed but you want to stop painting of the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ImageList
member.summary: Gets or sets the ImageList that contains the Image objects used by the tree nodes.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ImageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the image-list index value of the default image that is displayed by the tree nodes.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CheckBoxImageChecked
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom image that is displayed instead default check box representation when check box in cell is checked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CheckBoxImageUnChecked
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom image that is displayed instead default check box representation when check box in cell is unchecked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CheckBoxImageIndeterminate
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom image that is displayed instead default check box representation when check box in cell is in indeterminate state.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.NodesConnector
member.summary: Gets or sets the NodeConnector object that describes the type of the connector used for displaying connection between nested nodes. RootConnector property specifies the connector between root node and it's imidate nested nodes. This property specifies connector for all other nested levels. Default value is null.
member.remarks: You can use Node.ParentConnector property to specify per node connectors.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SelectedPathConnector
member.summary: Gets or sets the NodeConnector object that describes the type of the connector used for displaying connection between linked nodes. Connector specified here is used to display the connection between nodes that are on the path to the selected node. When set you can use it to visually indicate the path to the currently selected node. Default value is null.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CellLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout of the cells inside the node. Default value is Horizontal layout which means that cell are positioned horizontally next to each other.
member.remarks: You can specify cell layout on each node by using Node.CellLayout property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CellPartLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout of the cells inside the node. Default value is Horizontal layout which means that cell are positioned horizontally next to each other.
member.remarks: You can specify cell layout on each node by using Node.CellLayout property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ColorSchemeStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme style. Color scheme provides predefined colors based on popular visual styles. We recommend that you use "SchemePart" color settings since they maintain consistant look that is based on target system color scheme setting.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ColorScheme
member.summary: Gets the reference to the color scheme object.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CenterContent
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the content of the control is centered within the bounds of control. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SelectionPerCell
member.summary: Gets or sets whether per cell selection mode is enabled. In cell selection mode the selection box is drawn over selected cell only instead of all cells in the node. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SelectionFocusAware
member.summary: Gets or sets whether selection appearance changes depending on whether control has input focus. Default value is true. Setting this value to false causes selection box to be rendered as if control has focus all the time.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SelectionBoxStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the node selection box style.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SelectionBox
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether selection box is drawn around the selected node. Default value is true. Another way to provide the visual indication that node is selected is by using selected state style properties like NodeStyleSelected and CellStyleSelected.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SelectionBoxSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size/thickness in pixel of the selection box drawn around selected node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.FullRowSelect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether node is selected when mouse is pressed anywhere within node vertical bounds. Default value is true.
member.remarks: When set to false the node is selected only when mouse is pressed over the node content.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ExpandWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the total node expand area width in pixels. The expand button with ExpandButtonSize is fitted into this area. Default value is 24.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ExpandButtonSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the expand button that is used to expand/collapse node. Default value is 8,8.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ExpandBorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets expand button border color. Note that setting ExpandBorderColorSchemePart property will override the value that you set here.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ExpandBorderColorSchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets expand button color scheme border color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding ExpandBorderColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through ExpandBorderColor property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ExpandBackColor

Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through ExpandBackColor property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the expand button image which is used to indicate that node will be collapsed. To use images as expand buttons you also need to set ExpandButtonType=eExpandButtonType.Image.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.DisplayRootNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the display root node. Setting this property allows you to use any Node as root display node. Default value is Null which means that first node from AdvTree.Nodes collection is used as display root node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CellEdit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the label text of the node cells can be edited. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.IsCellEditing
member.summary: Returns whether cell editing is in progress.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.KeyboardSearchEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether keyboard incremental search through Node.Text property is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SearchBufferExpireTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the keyboard search buffer expiration timeout. Default value is 1000 which indicates that key pressed within 1 second will add to the search buffer and control will be searched for node text that begins with resulting string. Setting this value to 0 will disable the search buffer.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SearchBufferAutoClearNotFound
member.summary: Indicates whether search buffer is auto-cleared regardless of the expiration timeout if node is not found using current buffer content.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.DoubleClickTogglesNode
member.summary: Gets or sets whether double-clicking the node will toggle its expanded state. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.HotTracking
member.summary: Gets or sets whether node is highlighted when mouse enters the node. Default value is false.
member.remarks: There are two ways to enable the node hot-tracking. You can set the HotTracking property to true in which case the mouse tracking is enabled using system colors specified in TreeColorTable. You can also define the NodeStyleMouseOver style which gets applied to the node when mouse is over the node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.IsMovingColumn
member.summary: Gets whether tree is in process of moving the column in response to user finishing the column move action.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.View
member.summary: Gets or sets how control positions the items. Default value is standard TreeView layout.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.TileGroupLineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the group divider line when in tile view.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.MouseOverNode
member.summary: Returns the reference to the node mouse is currently over or null (Nothing) if mouse is not over any node in tree.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.DefaultCellCursor
member.summary: Specifies the mouse cursor displayed when mouse is over the cell. Default value is null which means that default control cursor is used.
member.remarks: To specify cursor for each individual cell use Cell.Cursor property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.HostedControlCells
member.summary: Gets reference to array of Cell objects that have HostedControl property set.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ClipHostedControls
member.summary: Gets or sets whether hosted controls are clipped so they don't overlap the control borders. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.InvalidControlBorder
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control border needs to be updated by calling UpdateControlBorderPanel()

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.VScrollBar
member.summary: Gets the reference to internal vertical scroll-bar control if one is created or null if no scrollbar is visible.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.VScrollBarVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Vertical Scroll-bar is shown if needed because content of the control exceeds available height. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.HScrollBarVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Horizontal Scroll-bar is shown if needed because content of the control exceeds available width. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.HScrollBar
member.summary: Gets the reference to internal horizontal scroll-bar control if one is created or null if no scrollbar is visible.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AutoScroll
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tree control enables the user to scroll to any nodes placed outside of its visible boundaries. This property is managed internally by AdvTree control and should not be modified.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AutoScrollMinSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the auto-scroll. Returns a Size that represents the minimum height and width of the scrolling area in pixels. This property is managed internally by AdvTree control and should not be modified.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AutoScrollPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the auto-scroll position.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.CheckedNodes
member.summary: Gets the list of all checked nodes in tree including child nodes.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.DropAsChildOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset in pixels from node's X position that is used during drag & drop operation to indicate that dragged node is dropped as child node of the parent's node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.DragDropNodeCopyEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether drag & drop internal implementation allows the copying of the node being dragged when CTRL key is pressed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.AllowExternalDrop
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control accepts the dragged nodes from other AdvTree controls. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.Indent
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance to indent each of the child tree node levels. Default value is 16.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.PaintDragDropInsertMarker
member.summary: Indicates whether drop marker is displayed during drag-drop operation.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.IsDragDropInProgress
member.summary: Gets or sets whether drag and drop operation is in progress. This member supports the AdvTree infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.MultiNodeDragCountVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether number of nodes being dragged is displayed on drag node preview. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.MultiNodeDragDropAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether multiple nodes drag & drop is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ResetAutoScrollPositionOnClearedNodes
member.summary: Indicates whether AutoScrollPosition is reset to 0,0 when all nodes are cleared from the tree. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.DisplayMembers
member.summary: Gets or sets the comma separated list of property or column names to display on popup tree control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source for the ComboTree. Expected is an object that implements the IList or IListSource interfaces, such as a DataSet or an Array. The default is null.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.FormattingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether formatting is applied to the DisplayMembers property of the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.FormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the format-specifier characters that indicate how a value is to be displayed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.FormatInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the IFormatProvider that provides custom formatting behavior.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ParentFieldNames
member.summary: Gets or sets comma separated field or property names that holds the value that is used to identify node and parent node. Format expected is: FieldNodeId,ParentNodeFieldId. For example if your table represents departments, you have DepartmentId field which uniquely identifies a department and ParentDepartmentId field which identifies parent of the department if any you would set this property to DepartmentId,ParentDepartmentId. Note that you can only use ParentFieldNames or GroupingMembers property but not both. If both are set ParentFieldName take precedence.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.GroupingMembers
member.summary: Gets or sets comma separated list of field or property names that are used for grouping when data-binding is used. Note that you can only use ParentFieldName or GroupingMembers property but not both. If both are set ParentFieldName take precedence.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.GroupNodeStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets style for automatically created group nodes when data-binding is used and GroupingMembers property is set.
member.value: Name of the style assigned or null value indicating that no style is used. Default value is null.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SelectedIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index specifying the currently selected item.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.ValueMember
member.summary: Gets or sets the property to use as the actual value for the items in the control. Applies to data-binding scenarios. SelectedValue property will return the value of selected node as indicated by this property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.SelectedValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the member property specified by the ValueMember property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.EnableDataPositionChange
member.summary: Indicates whether control changes the CurrencyManager.DataPosition when selected node is changed during data binding. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTree.TouchEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether touch support for scrolling is enabled.

member.name: T:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTreeSettings
member.summary: Static class that holds AdvTree settings that are not commonly used.

member.name: F:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTreeSettings.SelectedScrollIntoViewHorizontal
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tree control is scrolled horizontally so selected node is brought into the view. Default value is false. You can set this property to false to disable the horizontal scrolling of tree control when selected node has changed.

member.name: F:DevComponents.AdvTree.AdvTreeSettings.UseSortAlphaComparer
member.summary: Gets or sets whether AdvTree node comparer that provides column sorting uses standard text comparer instead of default hybrid alpha-numeric comparer. Default value is false.

member.name: T:DevComponents.AdvTree.ICellEditControl
member.summary: Defines an interface for cell edit control that allows custom controls to be used as cell editors. AdvTree control expects that editing control inherits from System.Windows.Forms.Control.

member.name: M:DevComponents.AdvTree.ICellEditControl.BeginEdit
member.summary: Called when edit operation is started. The AdvTree control will first set CurrentValue, then call BeginEdit and will call EditComplete once editing is completed.

member.name: M:DevComponents.AdvTree.ICellEditControl.EndEdit
member.summary: Called when edit operation is completed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ICellEditControl.CurrentValue
member.summary: Gets or sets current edit value.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.ICellEditControl.EditComplete
member.summary: AdvTree control subscribes to this event to be notified when edit operation is completed. For example when Enter key is pressed the edit control might raise this event to indicate the completion of editing operation.

member.name: E:DevComponents.AdvTree.ICellEditControl.CancelEdit
member.summary: AdvTree control subscribes to this event to be notified that user has cancelled the editing. For example when Escape key is pressed the edit control might raise this event to indicate that editing has been cancelled.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ICellEditControl.EditWordWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cell requests the word-wrap based on the current cell style. If your editor does not support word-wrap functionality this can be ignored.

member.name: T:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell
member.summary: Represents a cell assigned to the Node.

remarks.para: The Cell with Index 0 (zero) always exists for a Node and it is a cell that you can interact with through the properties on a node, which are forwarding to the Cell(0), or you can go directly to the Cell(0).
When Node has multiple columns defined each column corresponds to Cell in Node's Cells collection. The first Column has Index 0, second Column Index 1 and so forth.
Note that there is always at least one Cell in a Node even if multiple columns are not used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.Editable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cell content is editable when cell editing is enabled on tree control. Default value is true.

member.summary: Gets whether cell can be edited. Cell can be edited if both Editable property is set to true and ColumnHeader.Editable property is set to true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.HostedItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the item hosted inside of the cell. Only items that do not generate popups are supported. Note that cell can only host either HostedItem or HostedControl but not both.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.HostedControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the control hosted inside of the cell. Note that cell can only host either HostedItem or HostedControl but not both.

remarks.para: When control is hosted inside of the cell, cell size is determined by the size of the control hosted inside of it. The cell will not display its text but it will display any image assigned or check box when control is hosted inside of it. The Style settings like Margin and Padding will still apply.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.IgnoreHostedControlSizeChange
member.summary: Gets or sets whether hosted control size change event is ignored.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.HostedControlSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the hosted control size. Property is used to correctly scale control when AdvTree.Zoom is used to zoom view.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.IsEditing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the cell is in an editable state. true if the cell is in editable state; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.IsSelected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the cell is in the selected state. true if the cell is in the selected state; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.IsVisible
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the cell is visible. Cell is considered to be visible when it's parent column is visible.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent node of the current cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains data about the cell. Any Object derived type can be assigned to this property. If this property is being set through the Windows Forms designer, only text can be assigned.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.TagString
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains data about the cell. Any Object derived type can be assigned to this property. If this property is being set through the Windows Forms designer, only text can be assigned.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.TextDisplayFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format that is applied to the value of Text property for display purposes. See "Formatting Overview" in MSDN for description on available format strings. For example you can specify "C" to format text as currency, or "D" to format text as decimal number etc.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.DisplayText
member.summary: Gets the formatted display text.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed in the cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.TreeControl
member.summary: Gets the parent tree control that the cell belongs to.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.StyleNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets the style class assigned to the cell. Null value indicates that default style is used as specified on cell's parent.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned to the cell or null (VB Nothing) indicating that default style setting from tree control is applied. Default value is null.
member.remarks: When property is set to null (VB Nothing) the style setting from parent tree controls is used. CellStyleNormal on AdvTree control is a root style for a cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.StyleNormalName
member.summary: Gets or sets the style name used by cell. This member is provided for internal use only. To set or get the style use StyleNormal property instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.StyleSelected
member.summary: Gets or sets the style class that is to when cell is selected. Null value indicates that default style is used as specified on cell's parent.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned to the cell or null value indicating that default style setting from tree control is applied. Default is null value.
member.remarks: When property is set to null value the style setting from parent tree controls is used. CellStyleSelected on AdvTree control is a root style for a cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.StyleSelectedName
member.summary: Gets or sets the selected style name used by cell. This member is provided for internal use only. To set or get the style use StyleSelected property instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.StyleDisabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the disabled style class assigned to the cell. Null value indicates that default style is used as specified on cell's parent.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned to the cell or null value indicating that default style setting from tree control is applied. Default value is null.
member.remarks: When property is set to null value the style setting from parent tree controls is used. CellStyleDisabled on AdvTree control is a root style for a cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.StyleDisabledName
member.summary: Gets or sets the disabled style name used by cell. This member is provided for internal use only. To set or get the style use StyleDisabled property instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.StyleMouseDown
member.summary: Gets or sets the style class assigned to the cell which is applied when mouse button is pressed while mouse is over the cell. Null value indicates that default style is used as specified on cell's parent.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned to the cell or null value indicating that default style setting from tree control is applied. Default value is null.
member.remarks: When property is set to null value style setting from parent tree controls is used. CellStyleMouseDown on AdvTree control is a root style for a cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.StyleMouseDownName
member.summary: Gets or sets the mouse down style name used by cell. This member is provided for internal use only. To set or get the style use StyleMouseDown property instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.StyleMouseOver
member.summary: Gets or sets the style class assigned to the cell which is applied when mouse is over the cell. Null value indicates that default style is used as specified on cell's parent.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned to the cell or null value indicating that default style setting from tree control is applied. Default value is null.
member.remarks: When property is set to null value the style setting from parent tree controls is used. CellStyleMouseOver on AdvTree control is a root style for a cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.StyleMouseOverName
member.summary: Gets or sets the mouse over style name used by cell. This member is provided for internal use only. To set or get the style use StyleMouseOver property instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cell is enabled or not.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.Images
member.summary: Gets the reference to images associated with this cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.ImageAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the image alignment in relation to the text displayed by cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.CheckBoxAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the checkbox alignment in relation to the text displayed by cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.CheckBoxVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether check box is visible inside the cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.Checked
member.summary: Gets or set a value indicating whether the check box is in the checked state.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.CheckBoxThreeState
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the CheckBox will allow three check states rather than two. If the ThreeState property is set to true CheckState property should be used instead of Checked property to set the extended state of the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.CheckState
member.summary: Specifies the state of a control, such as a check box, that can be checked, unchecked, or set to an indeterminate state.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.CheckBoxStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the appearance style of the item. Default value is CheckBox. Item can also assume the style of radio-button.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.IsMouseOver
member.summary: Gets whether mouse is over the cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.IsMouseDown
member.summary: Gets whether left mouse button is pressed while over the cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.Layout
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout of the cell parts like check box, image and text. Layout can be horizontal (default) where parts of the cell are positioned next to each other horizontally, or vertical where parts of the cell are positioned on top of each other vertically. Alignment of the each part is controlled by alignment properties.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.Cursor
member.summary: Specifies the mouse cursor displayed when mouse is over the cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.WordWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cell wrapped the text during the layout.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.EditorType
member.summary: Gets or sets the editor type used to edit the cell. Setting this property to value other than Default overrides the cell editor type specified on column cell belongs to.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.Selectable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cell can be selected by user by clicking it with the mouse or using keyboard. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.CanSelect
member.summary: Gets whether cell can be selected. Cell must be Visible, Enabled and Selectable in order for it to be selected.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.ColumnHeader
member.summary: Returns ColumnHeader cell is under if one is defined and cell is already parented to the tree. Otherwise it returns null/nothing.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.TextMarkupBody
member.summary: Gets reference to parsed markup body element if text was markup otherwise returns null.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.TextMarkupEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cell supports and renders text markup. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.Cell.IsMarkupSupported
member.summary: Gets whether item supports text markup. Default is false.

member.name: T:DevComponents.AdvTree.CellEditEventArgs

member.summary: Indicates new text that will be assigned to the cell if one is appropriate for given event.

member.name: F:DevComponents.AdvTree.CellEditEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Indicates whether the current action is cancelled. For BeforeCellEdit event setting this property to true will cancel the editing. For AfterCellEdit event setting this property to true will cancel any changes made to the text and edits will not be accepted. For CellEditEnding event setting this property to true will keep the cell in edit mode.

member.name: F:DevComponents.AdvTree.CellEditEventArgs.IsUserCanceled
member.summary: Indicates whether editing operation was canceled by the end user, usually by pressing ESCAPE key.

member.remarks: If you plan to use alpha-blended images we recommend using PNG-24 format which supports alpha-blending. As of this writing .NET Framework 1.0 and 1.1 do not support alpha-blending when used through Image class.

member.summary: Initializes new instance of CellImages class.

member.summary: Makes a copy of a CellImages object.

member.summary: Changes the image and invokes largest image size calculation if the image size truly changed.

member.summary: Returns image from image list based on the image index.
member.param: Index of the image to return.

member.summary: Returns image from image list based on the image key.
member.param: Key of the image to return.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.CellImages.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets default cell image. Setting this property to valid image will override any setting of ImageIndex property.

remarks.para: The image set through this property will be serialized with the cell. If you plan to use ImageList then use ImageIndex property.

para.para: If you plan to use alpha-blended images we recommend using PNG-24 format which supports alpha-blending. As of this writing .NET Framework 1.0 and 1.1 do not support alpha-blending when used through Image class.

member.value: Image object or null (Nothing) if no image is assigned.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.CellImages.ImageMouseOver
member.summary: Gets or sets the image that is displayed when mouse is over the cell. Setting this property to valid image will override any setting of ImageMouseOverIndex property.
member.remarks: If you plan to use alpha-blended images we recommend using PNG-24 format which supports alpha-blending. As of this writting .NET Framework 1.0 and 1.1 do not support alpha-blending when used through Image class.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.CellImages.ImageDisabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the image that is displayed when cell is disabled. If not assigned disabled image is created from default cell image. Setting this property to valid image will override any setting of ImageDisabledIndex property.
member.remarks: If you plan to use alpha-blended images we recommend using PNG-24 format which supports alpha-blending. As of this writing .NET Framework 1.0 and 1.1 do not support alpha-blending when used through Image class.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.CellImages.ImageExpanded
member.summary: Gets or sets image that is displayed when Node that this cell belongs to is expanded. Setting this property to valid image will override any setting of ImageExpandedIndex property.
member.remarks: If you plan to use alpha-blended images we recommend using PNG-24 format which supports alpha-blending. As of this writing .NET Framework 1.0 and 1.1 do not support alpha-blending when used through Image class.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.CellImages.ImageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the Index of default cell image from ImageList specified on AdvTree control.
member.remarks: If you plan to use alpha-blended images we recommend using PNG-24 format which supports alpha-blending. As of this writing .NET Framework 1.0 and 1.1 do not support alpha-blending when used through Image class.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.CellImages.ImageKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the key of the default cell image from ImageList specified on AdvTree control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.CellImages.ImageList
member.summary: Property Editor support for ImageIndex selection

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.CellImages.ImageMouseOverIndex

member.summary: Gets or sets whether cells content in this column is editable when cell editing is enabled on tree control. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.MaxInputLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of characters the user can type or paste when editing cells in this column.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.Name
member.summary: Returns name of the column header that can be used to identify it from the code.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.Bounds
member.summary: Returns rectangle that this column occupies. If the layout has not been performed on the column the return value will be Rectangle.Empty.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.Width
member.summary: Gets the reference to the object that represents width of the column as either absolute or relative value.
member.remarks: Set Width using Absolute or Relative properties of ColumnWidth object.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.MinimumWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum column width in pixels that is enforced when user is resizing the columns using mouse. Default value is 0 which indicates that there is no minimum size constraint.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.StretchToFill
member.summary: Gets or sets whether column is stretched to fill any empty space horizontally in tree when all columns consume less width than available. Only one column in tree may have this property set to true and only last column with this property set will be stretched. You should always set the Width for the column since Width will be used when columns consume more space in tree horizontally than available. Applies to top-level columns only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.StyleNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets the style class assigned to the column. Empty value indicates that default style is used as specified on cell's parent's control.
member.value: Name of the style assigned to the cell or an empty string indicating that default style setting from tree control is applied. Default is empty string.
member.remarks: When property is set to an empty string the style setting from parent tree controls is used. ColumnStyleNormal on AdvTree control is a root style for a cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.StyleMouseDown
member.summary: Gets or sets the style class assigned to the column which is applied when mouse button is pressed over the header. Empty value indicates that default style is used as specified on column's parent.
member.value: Name of the style assigned to the column or an empty string indicating that default style setting from tree control is applied. Default is empty string.
member.remarks: When property is set to an empty string the style setting from parent tree controls is used. ColumnStyleMouseDown on AdvTree control is a root style for a cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.StyleMouseOver
member.summary: Gets or sets the style class assigned to the column which is applied when mouse is over the column. Empty value indicates that default style is used as specified on column's parent control.
member.value: Name of the style assigned to the column or an empty string indicating that default style setting from tree control is applied. Default is empty string.
member.remarks: When property is set to an empty string the style setting from parent tree controls is used. ColumnStyleMouseOver on AdvTree control is a root style for a cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.ColumnName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the column in the ColumnHeaderCollection.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the column caption.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether column is visible. Hiding the header column will also hide corresponding data column.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.ImageAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets Image alignment inside of column. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.DataFieldName
member.summary: Gets or sets the data-field or property name that is used as source of data for this column when data-binding is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets additional custom data associated with the column.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.CellsBackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the cells background for this column.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.DisplayIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets display index of the column. -1 indicates default value and is modified to actual display index when the column is added to a ColumnHeaderCollection.
member.remarks: A lower display index means a column will appear first (to the left) of columns with a higher display index. Allowable values are from 0 to num columns - 1. (-1 is legal only as the default value and is modified to something else when the column is added to a AdvTree's column collection). AdvTree enforces that no two columns have the same display index; changing the display index of a column will cause the index of other columns to adjust as well.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.SortingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether user can sort by this column by clicking it.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.SortDirection

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnHeader.DoubleClickAutoSize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether column is automatically sized to the content when user double-clicks the column on the column resize line. Column resizing must be enabled in order for this property to function. Default value is true which indicates that column will be auto-sized to content when user double-clicks the column resize marker.

member.name: T:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnWidth
member.summary: Represents the width of the Column. Supports absolute width in Pixels and relative width as percentage of the width of parent control.

member.summary: Creates new instance of the object.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnWidth.Relative
member.summary: Gets or sets relative width expressed as percentage between 1-100. 0 indicates that absolute width will be used.
member.remarks: Relative width is expressed as percentage between 1-100 of the parent controls width. 0 indicates that absolute width will be used. Absolute width always takes priority over relative width. For example value of 30 assigned to this property indicates that width of the column will be 30% of the total client width of the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnWidth.Absolute
member.summary: Gets or sets the absolute width of the column in pixels.
member.remarks: Absolute width always takes precedence over the relative width of the column.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnWidth.AutoSize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether column width is automatically set based on the column's content. Default value is false. When set absolute and relative size values are ignored.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnWidth.AutoSizeMinHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets whether column auto-width is set to minimum of the column header text width. Applies to AutoSize=true only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.AdvTree.ColumnWidth.AutoSizeWidth
member.summary: Gets the auto-size calculated width of the column after tree layout is performed and column has AutoSize=true.

member.name: F:DevComponents.Editors.NumericInputBase._ShowUpDown
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a spin button control (up-down control) is used to adjust the current value. The default is false.
When the ShowUpDown property is set to true, a spin button control is shown to adjust value of currently focused input item. The value can be adjusted by using the up and down buttons to change the value.

member.name: E:DevComponents.Editors.NumericInputBase.ButtonClearClick
member.summary: Occurs when Clear button is clicked and allows you to cancel the default action performed by the button.

member.name: E:DevComponents.Editors.NumericInputBase.ButtonDropDownClick
member.summary: Occurs when Drop-Down button that shows calendar is clicked and allows you to cancel showing of the popup.

member.name: E:DevComponents.Editors.NumericInputBase.LockUpdateChanged
member.summary: Occurs when ShowCheckBox property is set to true and user changes the lock status of the control by clicking the check-box.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.NumericInputBase.IsInputReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether input part of the control is read-only. When set to true the input part of the control becomes read-only and does not allow the typing. However, drop-down and up/down buttons part if visible still allows user to possibly change the value of the control through the method you can provide on drop-down or through up/down buttons. Use this property to allow change of the value through drop-down or up/down buttons only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.NumericInputBase.ShowCheckBox
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a check box is displayed to the left of the input value. Set to true if a check box is displayed to the left of the input value; otherwise, false. The default is false.
When the ShowCheckBox property is set to true, a check box is displayed to the left of the input in the control. When the check box is selected, the value can be updated. When the check box is cleared, the value is unable to be changed. You can handle the LockUpdateChanged event to be notified when this check box is checked and unchecked. Use LockUpdateChecked property to get or sets whether check box is checked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.NumericInputBase.LockUpdateChecked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether check box shown using ShowCheckBox property which locks/unlocks the control update is checked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.NumericInputBase.ButtonDropDown
member.summary: Gets the object that describes the settings for the button that shows drop-down when clicked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.NumericInputBase.ButtonClear
member.summary: Gets the object that describes the settings for the button that clears the content of the control when clicked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.NumericInputBase.ButtonFreeText
member.summary: Gets the object that describes the settings for the button that switches the control into the free-text entry mode when clicked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.NumericInputBase.ButtonCalculator
member.summary: Gets the object that describes the settings for the button that displays popup calculator.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.NumericInputBase.DisplayFormat
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Numeric String Format that is used to format the numeric value entered for display purpose. Read more about available formats in MSDN under "Standard Numeric Format Strings" and "Custom Numeric Format Strings" topics.
The format specified here indicates the format for display purpose only, not for the input purpose. For example to display the number in system Currency format set the DisplayFormat to 'C'.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.ShowCheckBox
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a check box is displayed to the left of the selected date. Set to true if a check box is displayed to the left of the selected date; otherwise, false. The default is false.
When the ShowCheckBox property is set to true, a check box is displayed to the left of the date in the control. When the check box is selected, the date/time value can be updated. When the check box is cleared, the date/time value is unable to be changed. You can handle the LockUpdateChanged event to be notified when this check box is checked and unchecked. Use LockUpdateChecked property to get or sets whether check box is checked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the date time value of the control. You can use IsEmpty property to check whether control holds an empty value. Setting this property to System.DateTime(0) will also make the control Empty if AllowEmptyState=true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.ValueObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the date/time value of the control as an object. This property allows you to bind to the database fields and supports null values. Expected value is DateTime object or null to indicate no date selected.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.Values
member.summary:
Gets or sets the values of the nested DateTimeGroup items.
When nested date-time groups are used note that some of the features of the control are disabled, notably minimum and maximum values for nested date-times.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.AllowEmptyState
member.summary: Gets or sets whether empty null/nothing state of the control is allowed. Default value is true which means that IsEmpty property may return true if input value is resets or ValueObject set to null/nothing.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control is empty i.e. it does not hold a valid DateTime value.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.MinDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum date and time that can be selected in the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.MaxDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum date and time that can be selected in the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format date/time is displayed in. To specify custom format set this value to Custom and specify custom format using CustomFormat property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.CustomFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom date/time format string.
member.remarks:
To display string literals that contain date and time separators or format strings listed below, you must use escape characters in the substring. For example, to display the date as "June 15 at 12:00 PM", set the CustomFormat property to "MMMM dd 'at' t:mm tt". If the "at" substring is not enclosed by escape characters, the result is "June 15 aP 12:00PM" because the "t" character is read as the one-letter A.M./P.M. format string (see the format string table below).
To display single quote in custom format use two single quotes characters like so '' after each other and they will be displayed as single quote.
The following list shows all the valid format strings and their descriptions:
Format String Description
d The one- or two-digit day.
dd The two-digit day. Single-digit day values are preceded by a 0.
ddd The three-character day-of-week abbreviation.
dddd The full day-of-week name.
jjj The three-digit day-of-year day. Single and two-digit values are preceded by 0.
j The three-digit day-of-year day.
h The one- or two-digit hour in 12-hour format.
hh The two-digit hour in 12-hour format. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
H The one- or two-digit hour in 24-hour format.
HH The two-digit hour in 24-hour format. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
m The one- or two-digit minute.
mm The two-digit minute. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
M The one- or two-digit month number.
MM The two-digit month number. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
MMM The three-character month abbreviation.
MMMM The full month name.
s The one- or two-digit seconds.
ss The two-digit seconds. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
t The one-letter A.M./P.M. abbreviation (A.M. is displayed as "A").
tt The two-letter A.M./P.M. abbreviation (A.M. is displayed as "AM").
y The one-digit year (2001 is displayed as "1").
yy The last two digits of the year (2001 is displayed as "01").
yyyy The full year (2001 is displayed as "2001").
{ Starts the nested date-time group inside of the control. Note that nested groups must always be closed. Nested date-time groups can be used to represent range of input date/time values in the control To access nested values use Values property. For example to have control represent the input from two time values you could set CustomFormat to 'from' {HH:mm} 'to' {HH:mm} which will create two nested date/time groups that represent the time value. Entered time values can be accessed through Values property which return an array of all input values.
} Ends the nested date-time input group.

member.summary: The center is removed from trimmed lines and replaced by an ellipsis. The algorithm keeps as much of the last slash-delimited segment of the line as possible.

member.summary: Specifies that text is trimmed to the nearest word, and an ellipsis is inserted at the end of a trimmed line.

member.summary: Specifies no trimming.

member.summary: Specifies that text is trimmed to the nearest word.

member.name: M:DevComponents.AdvTree.Node.Expand
member.summary: Expands the node.
member.remarks: The Expand method expands the current Node down to the next level of nodes. The state of a Node is persisted. For example, if the next level of child nodes was not collapsed previously, when the Expand method is called, the child nodes appear in their previously expanded state.

member.name: M:DevComponents.AdvTree.Node.Expand(DevComponents.AdvTree.eTreeAction)
member.summary: Expands the node.
