member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.AllowEmptyState
member.summary: Gets or sets whether empty null/nothing state of the control is allowed. Default value is true which means that IsEmpty property may return true if input value is resets or ValueObject set to null/nothing.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.AutoAdvance
member.summary: Gets or sets whether input focus is automatically advanced to next input field when input is complete in current one.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.AutoSelectDate
member.summary: Gets or sets whether first day in month is automatically selected on popup date picker when month or year is changed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.AutoOverwrite
member.summary: Gets or sets whether auto-overwrite functionality for input is enabled. When in auto-overwrite mode input field will erase existing entry and start new one if typing is continued after InputComplete method is called.

member.summary: Specifies the background style of the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.DisplayControlForCurrentCellOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the control will be displayed for the current cell only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.DefaultInputValues
member.summary: Gets or sets whether empty input values (year, month or day) are set to defaults while user is entering data. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the control can respond to user interaction

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format date/time is displayed in. To specify custom format set this value to Custom and specify custom format using CustomFormat property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.InputHorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the input field alignment inside the control

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.IsInputReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether input part of the control is read-only. When set to true the input part of the control becomes read-only and does not allow the typing. However, drop-down part if visible still allows user to change the value of the control. Use this property to allow change of the value through drop-down picker only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.LockUpdateChecked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether check box shown using ShowCheckBox property which locks/unlocks the control update is checked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.MaxDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum date and time that can be selected in the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.MinDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum date and time that can be selected in the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.MonthCalendar
member.summary: Gets the reference to the internal MonthCalendarItem control which is used to display calendar when drop-down is open.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.SelectNextInputCharacters
member.summary: List of characters that when pressed would select next input field. For example if you are allowing time input you could set this property to : so when user presses the : character, the input is forwarded to the next input field.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.ShowCheckBox
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a check box is displayed to the left of the input value. Set to true if a check box is displayed to the left of the input value; otherwise, false. The default is false.
When the ShowCheckBox property is set to true, a check box is displayed to the left of the input in the control. When the check box is selected, the value can be updated. When the check box is cleared, the value is unable to be changed. You can handle the LockUpdateChanged event to be notified when this check box is checked and unchecked. Use LockUpdateChecked property to get or sets whether check box is checked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.ShowUpDown
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a spin button control (up-down control) is used to adjust the current value. The default is false.
When the ShowUpDown property is set to true, a spin button control is shown to adjust value of currently focused input item. The value can be adjusted by using the up and down buttons to change the value.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDoubleInputColumn.DisplayFormat
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Numeric String Format that is used to format the numeric value entered for display purpose. Read more about available formats in MSDN under "Standard Numeric Format Strings" and "Custom Numeric Format Strings" topics.
The format specified here indicates the format for display purpose only, not for the input purpose. For example to display the number in system Currency format set the DisplayFormat to 'C'.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.IpAddressInput.IsInputReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether input part of the control is read-only. When set to true the input part of the control becomes read-only and does not allow the typing. However, drop-down part if visible still allows user to possibly change the value of the control through the method you can provide on drop-down. Use this property to allow change of the value through drop-down button only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.IpAddressInput.ShowCheckBox
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a check box is displayed to the left of the input value. Set to true if a check box is displayed to the left of the input value; otherwise, false. The default is false.
When the ShowCheckBox property is set to true, a check box is displayed to the left of the input in the control. When the check box is selected, the value can be updated. When the check box is cleared, the value is unable to be changed. You can handle the LockUpdateChanged event to be notified when this check box is checked and unchecked. Use LockUpdateChecked property to get or sets whether check box is checked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.IpAddressInput.LockUpdateChecked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether check box shown using ShowCheckBox property which locks/unlocks the control update is checked.

member.summary: List of characters that when pressed would select next input field. For example if you are allowing time input you could set this property to : so when user presses the : character, the input is forwarded to the next input field.

member.summary: Gets a clone of the mask provider associated with this instance of the masked text box control. Returns masking language provider of type MaskedTextProvider.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.MaskFull
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether all required and optional inputs have been entered into the input mask. Returns true if all required and optional inputs have been entered; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.PasswordChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the character to be displayed in substitute for user input.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.PromptChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the character used to represent the absence of user input in MaskedTextBox. Returns character used to prompt the user for input. The default is an underscore (_).

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.ReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether text in control is read only. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.RejectInputOnFirstFailure
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the parsing of user input should stop after the first invalid character is reached. Returns true if processing of the input string should be terminated at the first parsing error; otherwise, false if processing should ignore all errors. The default is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.ResetOnPrompt
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how an input character that matches the prompt character should be handled. Returns true if the prompt character entered as input causes the current editable position in the mask to be reset; otherwise, false to indicate that the prompt character is to be processed as a normal input character. The default is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.ResetOnSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how a space input character should be handled. Returns true if the space input character causes the current editable position in the mask to be reset; otherwise, false to indicate that it is to be processed as a normal input character. The default is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.SelectedText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the currently selected text in the control.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of characters selected in the text box.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.SelectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting point of text selected in the text box.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the defined shortcuts are enabled.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text as it is currently displayed to the user.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.TextAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets how text is aligned in a masked text box control.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemControl.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Indicates to control that all further update operations should not result in layout and refresh of control content. Use this method to optimize the addition of new items to the control. This method supports nested calls meaning that multiple calls are allowed but they must be ended with appropriate number of EndUpdate calls. IsUpdateSuspended property returns whether update is suspended.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemControl.EndUpdate
member.summary: Indicates that update operation is complete and that control should perform layout and refresh to show changes. See BeginUpdate for more details.

member.summary: Indicates that update operation is complete and that control should perform layout and refresh to show changes. See BeginUpdate for more details.

member.summary: Invalidates the control layout and forces the control to recalculates the layout for the items it contains on next layout operation invoked using RecalcLayout method.
member.remarks: Call to this method is usually followed by the call to RecalcLayout method to perform the control layout.

member.name: T:DevComponents.DotNetBar.eSelectionMode
member.summary: Defines selection modes for list control.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.eSelectionMode.None
member.summary: Items cannot be selected.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.eSelectionMode.One
member.summary: Only one item at the time can be selected.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.eSelectionMode.MultiSimple
member.summary: Multiple items can be selected. A mouse click or pressing the SPACEBAR selects or deselects an item in the list.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.eSelectionMode.MultiExtended
member.summary: Multiple items can be selected. Pressing SHIFT and clicking the mouse or pressing SHIFT and one of the arrow keys (UP ARROW, DOWN ARROW, LEFT ARROW, and RIGHT ARROW) extends the selection from the previously selected item to the current item. Pressing CTRL and clicking the mouse selects or deselects an item in the list.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.ProgressBarX.ColorTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined color state table for progress bar. Color specified applies to items with Office 2007 style only. It does not have any effect on other styles. You can use ColorTable to indicate the state of the operation that Progress Bar is tracking. Default value is eProgressBarItemColor.Normal.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.SideNavItem.AutoCollapseOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-collapse (fold) when clicked. When item is on popup menu and this property is set to false, menu will not close when item is clicked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.SideNavItem.AutoExpandOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-expand when clicked. When item is on top level bar and not on menu and contains sub-items, sub-items will be shown only if user click the expand part of the button. Setting this propert to true will expand the button and show sub-items when user clicks anywhere inside of the button. Default value is false which indicates that button is expanded only if its expand part is clicked.

The context menu bar assigned here will be used to search for the items with the same Name or GlobalName property so global properties can be propagated when changed. You should assign this property to enable the Global Items feature to reach your ContextMenuBar.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.TabFormItem.AutoExpandOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-expand when clicked. When item is on top level bar and not on menu and contains sub-items, sub-items will be shown only if user click the expand part of the button. Setting this propert to true will expand the button and show sub-items when user clicks anywhere inside of the button. Default value is false which indicates that button is expanded only if its expand part is clicked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.TabFormStripControl.CanCustomize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control can be customized and items added by end-user using context menu to the quick access toolbar. Caption of the control must be visible for customization to be enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.TabFormStripControl.CaptionHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the explicit height of the caption provided by control. Caption height when set is composed of the TabGroupHeight and the value specified here. Default value is 0 which means that system default caption size is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.TabFormStripControl.CaptionVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether custom caption line provided by the control is visible. Default value is false. This property should be set to true when control is used on Office2007RibbonForm.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.TabFormStripControl.CaptionFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font for the form caption text when CaptionVisible=true. Default value is NULL which means that system font is used.

member.summary: Gets or sets the reference to the form which will host newly detached TabFormItem and its panel, an instance of TabParentForm. You can provide your own instance of TabParentForm and TabControl to use instead of controls creating them. You must provide both TabParentForm and TabControl. Provide these in BeforeTabFormItemDetach event.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxX.CommandKeyDown
member.summary: Occurs during preprocessing to handle command keys. Command keys are keys that always take precedence over regular input keys. Examples of command keys include accelerators and menu shortcuts. Set Handled=true to indicate that you handled the key and that it should not be passed for further processing.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxX.ScrollbarSkin
member.summary: Gets or sets the scrollbar skinning type when control is using Office 2007 style.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxX.Border
member.summary: Specifies the control border style. Default value has Class property set so the system style for the control is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxX.RenderMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the rendering mode used by control. Default value is eRenderMode.Global which means that static GlobalManager.Renderer is used. If set to Custom then Renderer property must also be set to the custom renderer that will be used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Controls.TextBoxX.Renderer
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom renderer used by the items on this control. RenderMode property must also be set to eRenderMode.Custom in order renderer specified here to be used.

member.summary: Gets or sets the watermark image displayed inside of the control when Text is not set and control does not have input focus.

member.summary: Gets or sets the watermark image alignment.

member.summary: Gets or sets the watermark (tip) text displayed inside of the control when Text is not set and control does not have input focus. This property supports text-markup.

member.summary: Gets or sets the watermark font.

member.summary: Gets or sets the watermark text color.

member.name: T:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Dpi
member.summary: Provides High DPI support for DotNetBar controls.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Dpi.NormalizeScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets whether scale factor when set is normalized so both Width and Height values are the same. Default value is false. If using ScaleMode=font the scale factor might not be same for Width and Height so this allows opportunity to keep existing size ratios on the DotNetBar sized controls. When set to true the scale factor Height will always be set to scale factor Width.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Dpi.AutoScaleImages
member.summary: Indicates whether controls will automatically scale current images based on the current DPI. Depending on scaling this may result in pixalted images. Best policy is to provide separate images for each DPI level Windows runs on and if you do that you need to set this property to false to disable automatic size scaling for the images. Default value is true which causes the images to be upscaled.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.QatFrequentCommands
member.summary: Gets the collection of the Quick Access Toolbar Frequently used commands. You should add existing buttons to this collection that you already have on the MetroToolbar controls or on the application menu. The list will be used to construct the frequently used menu that is displayed when Customize Quick Access Toolbar menu is displayed and it allows end-user to remove and add these frequently used commands to the QAT directly from this menu. Note that items you add here should not be items that are already on Quick Access Toolbar, i.e. in MetroShell.QuickToolbarItems collection.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.KeyTipsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether KeyTips functionality is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.AntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether anti-alias smoothing is used while painting. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.ShowIcon
member.summary: Indicates whether Form.Icon is shown in top-left corner.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.GlobalContextMenuBar
member.summary: Gets or sets the Context menu bar associated with the this control which is used as part of Global Items feature. The context menu bar assigned here will be used to search for the items with the same Name or GlobalName property so global properties can be propagated when changed. You should assign this property to enable the Global Items feature to reach your ContextMenuBar.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.CaptionVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether custom caption and quick access toolbar provided by the control is visible. Default value is false. This property should be set to true when control is used on MetroAppForm.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.CaptionFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font for the form caption text when CaptionVisible=true. Default value is NULL which means that system font is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.CaptionHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the explicit height of the caption provided by control. Caption height when set is composed of the TabGroupHeight and the value specified here. Default value is 0 which means that system default caption size is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.KeyTipsFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font that is used to display Key Tips (accelerator keys) when they are displayed. Default value is null which means that control Font is used for Key Tips display.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.BackgroundStyle
member.summary: Specifies the background style of the control.

member.summary: Gets or sets the currently selected MetroTabItem. MetroTabItems are selected using the Checked property. Only a single MetroTabItem can be selected (Checked) at any given time.

member.summary: Returns collection of quick toolbar access and caption items.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.MouseWheelTabScrollEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether mouse wheel scrolls through the Metro tabs. Default value is true.

member.summary: ImageList for images used on Items. Images specified here will always be used on menu-items and are by default used on all Bars.

member.summary: ImageList for medium-sized images used on Items.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.ImagesLarge
member.summary: ImageList for large-sized images used on Items.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.TabStop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can give the focus to this control using the TAB key. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.CanCustomize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control can be customized and items added by end-user using context menu to the quick access toolbar. Caption of the control must be visible for customization to be enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.UseExternalCustomization
member.summary: Gets or sets whether external implementation for metro toolbar and menu item customization will be used for customizing the control. When set to true it enables the displaying of MetroToolbar and menu item context menus which allow customization. You are responsible for adding the menu items to context menu to handle all aspects of item customization. See "MetroShell Control Quick Access Toolbar Customization" topic in help file under How To. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.UseCustomizeDialog
member.summary: Gets or sets whether customize dialog is used to customize the quick access toolbar. You can handle the EnterCustomize event to display your custom dialog instead of built-in dialog for customization. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.CategorizeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the categorization mode for the items on Quick Access Toolbar customize dialog box. Default value categorizes items by the toolbar they appear on.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.QatLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the Quick Access Toolbar layout description. You can use the value obtained from this property to save the customized Quick Access Toolbar into registry or into any other storage object. You can also set the saved layout description back to restore user customize layout.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.QatLayoutChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Quick Access Toolbar has been customized by end-user. You can use value of this property to determine whether Quick Access Toolbar layout that can be accessed using QatLayout property should be saved.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroTabItem.AutoCollapseOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-collapse (fold) when clicked. When item is on popup menu and this property is set to false, menu will not close when item is clicked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroTabItem.AutoExpandOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-expand when clicked. When item is on top level bar and not on menu and contains sub-items, sub-items will be shown only if user click the expand part of the button. Setting this propert to true will expand the button and show sub-items when user clicks anywhere inside of the button. Default value is false which indicates that button is expanded only if its expand part is clicked.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether Click event will be auto repeated when mouse button is kept pressed over the item.

member.summary: Gets or sets the auto-repeat interval for the click event when mouse button is kept pressed over the item.

member.summary: Occurs when property grid needs property names translated for UI.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.AdvPropertyGrid.PrepareErrorSuperTooltip
member.summary: Occurs when Super Tooltip that is displayed for the error that occurred when property is being set is being assigned to a property node. This event allows you to customize the super tooltip displayed.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.AdvPropertyGrid.ConvertPropertyValueToString
member.summary: Occurs when property value is being converted to text representation for display. You can handle this event to provide custom conversion for property values. You must set IsConverted=true on event arguments to indicate that you have performed value conversion.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.AdvPropertyGrid.ConvertFromStringToPropertyValue
member.summary: Occurs when text entered by user is being converted to typed property value to be assigned to the property. You can handle this event to provide custom conversion for property values. You must set IsConverted=true on event arguments to indicate that you have performed value conversion.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.AdvPropertyGrid.ProvidePropertyValueList
member.summary: Occurs when property looks for the list of valid values for the property to show on either drop-down or use in auto-complete list. For example when property type is enum the internal implementation will convert available enum values into string list and use on drop-down and in auto-complete list. You can use this event to provide custom value list in combination with ConvertPropertyValueToString, ConvertFromStringToPropertyValue events. You must set IsListValid=true on event arguments to indicate that list your provided should be used.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.AdvPropertyGrid.ProvideUITypeEditor
member.summary: Occurs when property node needs the UITypeEditor for the property. You can handle this event and provide your own UITypeEditor to be used instead of the one specified on the property.

member.summary: Occurs when user changes the value of the property in property grid.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.AdvPropertyGrid.PropertyValueChanging
member.summary: Occurs before property value entered by the user is set on the property. You can cancel internal assignment by property grid by setting Handled=true on event arguments.

member.summary: Occurs when users changes the property value and attempts to commit the changes. This even allows you to validate the value and show error message if value is invalid and cancel its application.

member.summary: Specifies the container background style. Default value is an empty style which means that container does not display any background. BeginGroup property set to true will override this style on some styles.

member.summary: Gets or sets the item alignment when container is in horizontal layout. Default value is Left.

member.summary: Gets or sets the item vertical alignment. Default value is Top.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether items in horizontal layout are wrapped into the new line when they cannot fit allotted container size. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.ItemSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets spacing in pixels between items. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.FixedSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the suggested fixed size of the container. Width or Height or Both may be set to suggest fixed size for the container.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets orientation inside the container. Do not change the value of this property. It is managed by system only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.LayoutOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets orientation inside the container.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.ResizeItemsToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items contained by container are resized to fit the container bounds. When container is in horizontal layout mode then all items will have the same height. When container is in vertical layout mode then all items will have the same width. Default value is true.

member.summary: IBlock member implementation

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Expanded

member.summary: Returns whether instance of the item container is used as system container internally by DotNetBar.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.AccessibleRole
member.summary: Gets or sets the accessible role of the item.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.TitleStyle
member.summary: Specifies the title background style.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.TitleVisible
member.summary: Indicates whether TitleText is visible if set. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.TitleText
member.summary: Gets or sets the title text for the container.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.TitlePosition
member.summary: Gets or sets position of title text.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.KeyTips
member.summary: Gets or sets the Key Tips access key or keys for the item when on Ribbon Control or Ribbon Bar. Use KeyTips property when you want to assign the one or more letters to be used to access an item. For example assigning the FN to KeyTips property will require the user to press F then N keys to select an item. Pressing the F letter will show only keytips for the items that start with letter F.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.AutoCollapseOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-collapse (fold) when clicked. When item is on popup menu and this property is set to false, menu will not close when item is clicked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.CanCustomize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether item can be customized by end user.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Category
member.summary: Returns category for this item. If item cannot be customzied using the customize dialog category is empty string.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.ClickAutoRepeat
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Click event will be auto repeated when mouse button is kept pressed over the item.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.ClickRepeatInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the auto-repeat interval for the click event when mouse button is kept pressed over the item.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Cursor
member.summary: Specifes the mouse cursor displayed when mouse is over the item.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets item description. This description is displayed in Customize dialog to describe the item function in an application.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item is enabled.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.GlobalItem
member.summary: Gets or sets whether item is global or not. This flag is used to propagate property changes to all items with the same name. Setting for example Visible property on the item that has GlobalItem set to true will set visible property to the same value on all items with the same name.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.ItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets item alignment inside the container.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Shortcuts
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of shortcut keys associated with the item.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.ShowSubItems
member.summary: Gets or sets whether item will display sub items.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Stretch
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the item expands automatically to fill out the remaining space inside the container. Applies to Items on stretchable, no-wrap Bars only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.ThemeAware
member.summary: Specifies whether item is drawn using Themes when running on OS that supports themes like Windows XP.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.Tooltip
member.summary: Gets/Sets informational text (tooltip) for the item.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.KeyboardNavigationEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether container responds to keyboard presses and changes the active/mouse over item.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.PropertySettings.ConvertPropertyValueToString
member.summary: Occurs when property value is being converted to text representation for display. You can handle this event to provide custom conversion for property values. You must set IsConverted=true on event arguments to indicate that you have performed value conversion.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.PropertySettings.ConvertFromStringToPropertyValue
member.summary: Occurs when text entered by user is being converted to typed property value to be assigned to the property. You can handle this event to provide custom conversion for property values. You must set IsConverted=true on event arguments to indicate that you have performed value conversion.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.PropertySettings.ProvidePropertyValueList
member.summary: Occurs when property looks for the list of valid values for the property to show on either drop-down or use in auto-complete list. For example when property type is enum the internal implementation will convert available enum values into string list and use on drop-down and in auto-complete list. You can use this event to provide custom value list in combination with ConvertPropertyValueToString, ConvertFromStringToPropertyValue events. You must set IsListValid=true on event arguments to indicate that list your provided should be used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.PropertySettings.ReadOnlyStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets read-only property style.
member.value: Default value is null.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether property is in read-only state. Default value is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the SuperTooltip that is displayed when property is in read-only state (ReadOnly=true).

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.PropertySettings.Tooltip
member.summary: Gets or sets the SuperTooltip that is assigned to the property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the image that is displayed next to the property name in the grid.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.PropertySettings.ImageAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the image alignment in relation to the property name inside of the grid cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.PropertySettings.Category
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom category node will be placed in instead of category specified by Category attribute.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.PropertySettings.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom property name that is displayed in the grid instead of the real property name.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.PropertySettings.PropertyName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property that is managed by this informational object. If you set PropertyDescriptor than that is the value that will be used by the control regardless of PropertyName value. If you set PropertyName but not PropertyDescriptor then all properties with given name regardless of type will use these settings.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.PropertySettings.PropertyDescriptor
member.summary: Gets or sets property descriptor that identifies the property settings apply to. If you set PropertyDescriptor than that is the value that will be used by the control regardless of PropertyName value. If you set PropertyName but not PropertyDescriptor then all properties with given name regardless of type will use these settings.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RadialMenu.MenuType
member.summary: Indicates the radial menu type. eRadialMenuType.Segment menu type allows for display of image, text and any sub-menu items. eRadialMenuType.Circular allows only for display of Symbol or Image and it does not display either text or sub-menu items. eRadialMenuType.Circular is designed to be used for single level menus only that don't need text.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RatingItem.AverageRating
member.summary: Gets or sets the average rating shown by control. Control will display average rating (if set) when no explicit Rating value is set through Rating property. Minimum value is 0 and Maximum value is controlled by NumberOfStars property value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the AverageRating property. This property is provided for Data-Binding with NULL value support.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RatingItem.Rating
member.summary: Gets or sets the rating value represented by the control. Default value is 0 which indicates that there is no rating set. Maximum value is controlled by NumberOfStars property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Rating property value. This property is provided for Data-Binding with NULL value support.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RatingItem.IsEditable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether rating can be edited. Default value is true.

member.summary: Specifies the control background style. Default value is an empty style which means that container does not display any background.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RatingItem.CustomImages
member.summary: Gets the reference to custom rating images.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether text assigned to the check box is visible. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RatingItem.TextColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the text color. Default value is Color.Empty which indicates that default color is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RatingItem.TextSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing between optional text and the rating.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RatingItem.RatingOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of rating control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RatingItem.NumberOfStars
member.summary: Indicates number of stars used for the rating. Minium value is 2 stars.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RatingItem.IsMarkupSupported
member.summary: Gets whether item supports text markup. Default is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether text-markup support is enabled for items Text property. Default value is true. Set this property to false to display HTML or other markup in the item instead of it being parsed as text-markup.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.ButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a button with Office 2007 style. The collection by default has elements that are created to represents the members of eButtonColor enumeration. The name of each color table object is the same as the string enum representation. You can add custom members to this collection or modify the existing ones. Note that you must specify the unique name for the new color table elements. Name specified there can be used in ButtonItem.CustomColorName property to specify custom color table for an ButtonItem.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.RibbonButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a button with Office 2007 style when button is on RibbonBar control. When collection is empty the values from the ButtonItemColors collections are used instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.MenuButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a button with Office 2007 style when button is on menu bar. When collection is empty the values from the ButtonItemColors collections are used instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.ApplicationButtonColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by Ribbon Application Menu Button in Office 2010 style.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.BackstageButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by buttons that are on Backstage tab-strip.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.NavigationPaneButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by buttons that are on NavigationPane control. Currently used for Office 2010 style only. When empty ButtonItemColors is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.RibbonTabItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007RibbonTabItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a ribbon tab with Office 2007 style. The collection by default has elements that are created to represents the members of eRibbonTabColor enumeration. The name of each color table object is the same as the string enum representation. You can add custom members to this collection or modify the existing ones. Note that you must specify the unique name for the new color table elements. Name specified there can be used in RibbonTabItem.CustomColorName property to specify custom color table for an ButtonItem.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.RibbonTabGroupColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007RibbonTabGroupColorTableCollection objects the describe colors used by a ribbon tab groups with Office 2007 style. The collection by default has elements that are created to represents the members of eRibbonTabGroupColor enumeration. The name of each color table object is the same as the string enum representation. You can add custom members to this collection or modify the existing ones. Note that you must specify the unique name for the new color table elements.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.SetSelectionRange(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Sets the selected dates in a month calendar control to the specified date range.
member.param: The beginning date of the selection range.
The end date of the selection range.
member.exception:
startDate is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or-
startDate is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
-or-
endDate is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or- endDate is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
member.remarks: If the startDate value is greater than endDate property value, the dates are swapped; the endDate value becomes the starting date, and startDate value becomes the end date.

member.summary: Occurs when SelectedDate property has changed.

member.name: E:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.DateSelected
member.summary:
Occurs when the user makes an explicit date selection using the mouse.
This event is similar to the DateChanged event, but it occurs at the end of a date selection made using the mouse. The DateChanged event occurs during any date selection, whether by mouse, keyboard, or code. You should handle this event when you enable multiple date selection through MultiSelect property and want to be notified after the date selection has been made. DateChanged event would fire each time selection changes during the selection of multiple dates.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.MonthlyMarkedDates
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of DateTime objects that determine which monthly days to mark using Colors.MonthlyMarker settings. Make sure to call UpdateMarkedDates() method to update calendar display with marked dates.

member.summary: Gets or sets the array of DayOfWeek members that determine which days of week to mark using Colors.WeeklyMarker settings.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.AnnuallyMarkedDates

member.summary: Gets or sets whether selection of multiple dates up to the MaxSelectionCount is enabled. Default value is false which indicates that only single day can be selected.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of days that can be selected in a month calendar control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.SelectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the start date of the selected range of dates.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.SelectionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the end date of the selected range of dates.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.SelectionRange
member.summary:
Gets or sets the selected range of dates for a month calendar control.
Setting this property is functionally equivalent to using the SetSelectionRange method. You can set the start and end dates separately by setting either the SelectionStart or SelectionEnd properties. You cannot change the start and end dates by setting the SelectionRange.Start or SelectionRange.End property values of the SelectionRange property. You should use SelectionStart, SelectionEnd, or SetSelectionRange. If the Start property value of the SelectionRange is greater than its End property value, the dates are swapped; the End property value becomes the starting date, and Start property value becomes the end date.

member.summary: Sets the selected dates in a month calendar control to the specified date range.
member.param: The beginning date of the selection range.
The end date of the selection range.
member.exception:
startDate is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or-
startDate is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
-or-
endDate is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or- endDate is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
member.remarks: If the startDate value is greater than endDate property value, the dates are swapped; the endDate value becomes the starting date, and startDate value becomes the end date.

member.name: E:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.DateSelected
member.summary:
Occurs when the user makes an explicit date selection using the mouse.
This event is similar to the DateChanged event, but it occurs at the end of a date selection made using the mouse. The DateChanged event occurs during any date selection, whether by mouse, keyboard, or code. You should handle this event when you enable multiple date selection through MultiSelect property and want to be notified after the date selection has been made. DateChanged event would fire each time selection changes during the selection of multiple dates.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.MaxSelectionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of days that can be selected in a month calendar control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.SelectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the start date of the selected range of dates.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.SelectionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the end date of the selected range of dates.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.SelectionRange
member.summary:
Gets or sets the selected range of dates for a month calendar control.
Setting this property is functionally equivalent to using the SetSelectionRange method. You can set the start and end dates separately by setting either the SelectionStart or SelectionEnd properties. You cannot change the start and end dates by setting the SelectionRange.Start or SelectionRange.End property values of the SelectionRange property. You should use SelectionStart, SelectionEnd, or SetSelectionRange. If the Start property value of the SelectionRange is greater than its End property value, the dates are swapped; the End property value becomes the starting date, and Start property value becomes the end date.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.MultiSelect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether selection of multiple dates up to the MaxSelectionCount is enabled. Default value is false which indicates that only single day can be selected.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.MonthlyMarkedDates
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of DateTime objects that determine which monthly days to mark using Colors.MonthlyMarker settings.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.WeeklyMarkedDays
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of DayOfWeek members that determine which days of week to mark using Colors.WeeklyMarker settings.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.AnnuallyMarkedDates
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of DateTime objects that determines which annual days are marked using Colors.AnnualMarker settings.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.MarkedDates
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of DateTime objects that determines which nonrecurring dates are marked using Colors.DayMarker settings.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.DisplayMonth
member.summary: Gets or sets the first month displayed by the control.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPopupCloseEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the closing of the ribbon menu is canceled.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPopupCloseEventArgs.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the source object that was cause of the menu closing. For example this could be reference to an item that was clicked. Default value is null which indicates that there is no information about the object that caused closing available.

remarks.para: Following is the possible list of types that this property could be set to and causes for closing:

list.item: BaseItem - when an item is clicked the Source will be set to the instance of the item that was clicked.
RibbonControl - when parent form RibbonControl is on loses the input focus the Source will be set to the RibbonControl

RibbonTabItem - when tab menu is displayed and user clicks the same tab to close the menu. The RibbonTabItem with EventSource=Code will be also set as source when user double-clicks the tab to maximize the ribbon.
Any other type if RibbonControl.PopupRibbon method is called by your code.

member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the item in pixels.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.MinimumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the item. When used please note that layout logic for dockable windows expects that all DockContainerItems that are in particular docking side have exact same minimum size. When setting this property it is best to set the same value for all DockContainerItem instances you create.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.DefaultFloatingSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default floating size of the Bar that is containing this item.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.MinFormClientSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the form client area that is tried to maintain when dockable window is resized.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.Stretch
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the item expands automatically to fill out the remaining space inside the container. Applies to Items on stretchable, no-wrap Bars only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.CanCustomize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether item can be customized by end user.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.DesignMode
member.summary: Returns whether item is in design mode or not.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.GlobalItem
member.summary: Gets or sets whether item is global or not. This flag is used to propagate property changes to all items with the same name. Setting for example Visible property on the item that has GlobalItem set to true will set visible property to the same value on all items with the same name.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.CanClose
member.summary: Gets or sets the close button behavior on the host Bar. Default value is eDockContainerClose.Inherit which means that Bar.CanHide will control whether DockContainerItem can be closed.

member.summary: Closing of the bar is inherited from the host bar. Bar.CanHide property will control close button visibility.

member.summary: Closing of the DockContainerItem is allowed.

member.summary: Forces the loading of the definition specified in DefinitionName property. By default definition is loaded after parent form handle has been created and form is loaded. However, under certain circumstances you might need DotNetBar to load definition right away so you can access bars and items. We recommend moving the code to Form Load event and leaving the loading process for DotNetBar definition as is.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DockTabClosing
member.summary: Occurs on dockable bars when end-user attempts to close the individual DockContainerItem objects using system buttons on dock tab. Event can be canceled by setting the Cancel property of event arguments to true. This even will occur only after user presses the X button on tab that is displaying the dockable windows/documents.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DockTabClosed
member.summary: Occurs on dockable bars after DockContainerItem is closed. This action cannot be cancelled.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrive any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.TextBoxItemTextChanged
member.summary: Occurs when TextBoxItem input text has changed.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ColorPickerSelectedColorChanged
member.summary: Occurs when color on ColorPickerDropDown is choosen from drop-down color picker or from Custom Colors dialog box. Selected color can be accessed through SelectedColor property.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ButtonCheckedChanged
member.summary: Occurs when Checked property of an button has changed.

member.summary: Gets or sets docking splitter size.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.EnableDockCtrlTabKey
member.summary: Indicates whether Ctrl+Tab keys cycles the currently selected dock tab.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.GlobalContextMenuBar
member.summary: Gets or sets the Context menu bar associated with the this control which is used as part of Global Items feature. The context menu bar assigned here will be used to search for the items with the same Name or GlobalName property so global properties can be propagated when changed. You should assign this property to enable the Global Items feature to reach your ContextMenuBar.

member.summary: Gets or sets the form DotNetBarManager is attached to.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ParentUserControl

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ActiveDockContainerItem
member.summary: Gets currently focused (active) DockContainerItem. Note that only if DockContainer Item has input focus it will be consider active so there can only be one active DockContainerItem at a time.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets whether component has been disposed.
member.remarks: Disposed will return true after Dispose method has been executed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DisposeGCCollect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether GC.Collect() is called when this component is disposed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.MinimumClientSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum client size that docking windows will try to maintain for the client area (not occupied by dock windows). Note that this value is suggested value and cannot be observed when form is resized below the minimum size required for the given layout. Default value is 48x48 pixels.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DockingHintsEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether DotNetBar provides docking hints for easy docking of bars.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.EnableFullSizeDock
member.summary: Gets or sets whether user can control how first bar is docked when using docking hints (default value is True). When enabled (default value) placing the mouse over the middle docking hint will dock the bar at partial size and using the far docking hint will dock bar at full size. Full size indicates that dock site which hosts the bar consumes all the space of the parent form while partial size indicates that dock site consumes the full size minus the space of the other dock sites. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ApplyDocumentBarStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets whether uniform styling is applied to bars docked as documents. Default value is true which means that bar that will be docked as document will have it's style changed so it fits in default document styling. Such bars will have GrabHandleStyle=None, DockTabAlignment=Top and AlwaysDisplayDockTab=true. Set this property to false to have bars keep these properties once they are docked as documents. Value of these properties will be returned back to the default values once bar is not docked as document.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.Bars
member.summary: Gets the collection of the Bar objects associated with DotNetBarManager.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AutoDispatchShortcuts
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of shortcut keys that are automatically dispatched to the control that has focus even if they are handled and used by one of the items. This gives you fine control over which shortcuts are passed through the system and which ones are marked as handled by DotNetBar.

member.summary: Suspends the bar layout for all bars.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.MenuDropShadow
member.summary: Specifes whether drop shadow is displayed for Menus and pop-up Bars. OfficeXP Style only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AlphaBlendShadow
member.summary: Specifes whether to use Alpha-Blending shadows for pop-up items if supported by target OS. Disabling Alpha-Blended shadows can improve performance.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DisabledImagesGrayScale
member.summary: Gets or sets whether gray-scale algorithm is used to create automatic gray-scale images. Default is true.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether hooks are used for internal DotNetBar system functionality. Using hooks is recommended only if DotNetBar is used in hybrid environments like Visual Studio designers or IE.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.IsLoadingDefinition
member.summary: Returns whether definition is being currently loaded.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.IncludeDockDocumentsInDefinition
member.summary: Gets or sets whether document bars are saved in definition file. Default value is false which means that document bars are not saved as part of definition file. You can set this value to true to save document bar to definition file and be able to load them.
member.remarks: Note that by default Document bars that you created during design-time get member variables assigned to them by Windows Forms designer. If you decide to save definition of such bars and load definition back member variables will not point to correct bar instances since loading definition recreates all bars from scratch. You should always use Bars collection to access bars when saving and loading definitions.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ColorScheme
member.summary: Gets or sets Color scheme for all bars. Note that you need to set UseGlobalColorScheme to true to indicate that this ColorScheme object will be used on all bars managed by this instance of DotNetBarManager.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.UseGlobalColorScheme
member.summary: Gets or sets whether ColorScheme object on DotNetBarManager is used as a default ColorScheme for all bars managed by DotNetBarManager. Default value is false which indicates that ColorScheme on each Bar is used. When set to true each bar will use the ColorScheme settings from DotNetBarManager and it will ignore any setting on the Bar.ColorScheme object.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AlwaysShowFullMenus
member.summary: Indicates whether the Personalized menu setting is ignored and full menus are always shown.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AlwaysDisplayKeyAccelerators
member.summary: Gets or sets whether accelerator letters for menu or toolbar commands are underlined regardless of current Windows settings. Accelerator keys allow easy access to menu commands by using Alt + choosen key (letter). Default value is false which indicates that system setting is used to determine whether accelerator letters are underlined. Setting this property to true will always display accelerator letter underlined.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.ApplyFontStyle(DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle)
member.summary: Applies a "child/inherited" style text and box properties but not any background or border properties to this style. Use this method to create style hierarchies.
member.param: Style to apply to this style

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.ApplyStyle(DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle)
member.summary: Applies a "child/inherited" style to this style. Use this method to create style hierarchies.
member.remarks: This method is used to support style hierarchies where a base style is defined and inherited/child styles are derived and based on it. By using this method on the base style you can apply only style changes defined by the child style. For example if you defined a base style for normal user interface element then in most cases you do not want to redefine the styling for the case when same user interface element is selected. You will just defined the behavior of the selected state and then apply it to the base normal style using ApplyStyle method.
member.param: Style to apply to current style.

member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for UI element. If used in combination with BackgroundColor2 is specifies starting gradient color.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.BackColorSchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as background color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BackColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor property.

Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor2 property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the border color for all sides. Specifing the color for the side will override this value.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.BorderColorSchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as border color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BorderColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BorderColor property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.BorderColor2
member.summary: Gets or sets the target background gradient color for border on all sides. Specifing the color for the side will override this value. Gradient border colors be employed only when per side border color is not specified.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.BorderColor2SchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as taget gradient border color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BorderColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BorderColor property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the border gradient angle. Default value is 90.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether Click event is triggering expand/collapse of the splitter. Default value is true.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether DoubleClick event is triggering expand/collapse of the splitter. Default value is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether splitter will act as expandable splitter. Default value is true. When set to true ExpandableControl property should be set to the control that should be expanded/collapsed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the control that will be expanded/collapsed by the splitter. Default value is null. Expandable property should be also set to true (default) to enable expand/collapse functionality.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets visual style of the control. Default value is eSplitterStyle.Office2003.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.AnimationTime
member.summary: Gets or sets animation time in milliseconds. Default value is 100 miliseconds. You can set this to 0 (zero) to disable animation.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.Shortcut
member.summary: Gets or sets the shortcut key to expand/collapse splitter.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for UI element. If used in combination with BackgroundColor2 is specifies starting gradient color.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColorSchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as background color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BackColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColor2
member.summary: Gets or sets the target gradient background color for UI element.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColor2SchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as target gradient background color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BackColor2 property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor2 property.

member.summary: Occurs before tooltip for an item is shown. Sender could be the BaseItem or derived class for which tooltip is being displayed or it could be a ToolTip object itself it tooltip is not displayed for any item in particular.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrive any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.SuspendLayoutDisplay
member.summary: Suspends the layout and painting of the control. When you want to perform multiple operations on the explorer bar and you want to ensure that layout of the items on it and painting is not performed for performance and appearance reasons set this property to true. Once you want to enable layout and painting set the property back to false and call RecalcLayout method. Default value is false.

member.summary: Applies the stock style to the object.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.DisabledImagesGrayScale
member.summary: Gets or sets whether gray-scale algorithm is used to create automatic gray-scale images. Default is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.GroupButtonExpandNormal
member.summary: Specifies custom image to be used as button on ExplorerBarGroup item to expand the group. Default value is null which indicates that default button is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.GroupButtonExpandHot
member.summary: Specifies custom image to be used as button on ExplorerBarGroup item to expand the group. This image is used when mouse is over the button. Default value is null which indicates that default button is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.GroupButtonExpandPressed
member.summary: Specifies custom image to be used as button on ExplorerBarGroup item to expand the group. This image is used when user presses left mouse button while cursor is positioned over the button. Default value is null which indicates that default button is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.GroupButtonCollapseNormal
member.summary: Specifies custom image to be used as button on ExplorerBarGroup item to collapse the group. Default value is null which indicates that default button is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.GroupButtonCollapseHot
member.summary: Specifies custom image to be used as button on ExplorerBarGroup item to collapse the group. This Image is used when mouse is over the button. Default value is null which indicates that default button is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.GroupButtonCollapsePressed
member.summary: Specifies custom image to be used as button on ExplorerBarGroup item to collapse the group. This Image is used when left mouse button is pressed while cursor is over the button. Default value is null which indicates that default button is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.Images
member.summary: ImageList for images used on Items. Images specified here will always be used on menu-items and are by default used on all Bars.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.GroupImages
member.summary: ImageList for images displayed on the Group Item.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.DevComponents#DotNetBar#IOwner#ImagesLarge

member.summary: Popup selected pane when control is collapsed. Use PopupPaneVisible property to check whether currently selected pane is displayed as popup.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.HideSelectedPopupPane
member.summary: Hides popup selected pane when control is collapsed and selected pane is displayed as popup. When control is collapsed (Expanded=false) currently selected pane can be displayed as popup. Calling this method will hide the popup pane. Use PopupPaneVisible property to check whether currently selected pane is displayed as popup.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether selected pane is displayed as popup when control is collapsed (Expanded=false). Using navigation pane button that is displayed when control is collapsed user can popup or close currently selected pane without expanding the control. You can use this property to do same from code as well as check whether selected pane is displayed as popup. Note that control must be collapsed (Expanded=false) in order for this property to have any effect.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ProgressBarItem.ProgressType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of progress bar used to indicate progress. The Standard style displays the progress based on Minimum, Maximum and current Value. The Marquee type is automatically moving progress bar that is used to indicate an ongoing operation for which the actual duration cannot be estimated.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ProgressBarItem.MarqueeAnimationSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the marquee animation speed in milliseconds.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ProgressBarItem.ColorTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined color state table for progress bar. Color specified applies to items with Office 2007 style only. It does not have any effect on other styles. You can use ColorTable to indicate the state of the operation that Progress Bar is tracking. Default value is eProgressBarItemColor.Normal.
