member.summary: Gets or sets whether items in horizontal layout are wrapped into the new line when they cannot fit allotted container size. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.ResizeItemsToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items contained by container are resized to fit the container bounds. When container is in horizontal layout mode then all items will have the same height. When container is in vertical layout mode then all items will have the same width. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.PopupUsesStandardScrollbars
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Gallery when on popup is using standard scrollbars to scroll the content. Standard scrollbars are displayed on right hand side of the Gallery. Default value for this property is true. When set to false the scroll buttons are displayed only when needed and two buttons on top and bottom of the Gallery are used to indicate the scrolling possibility and enable scrolling. Buttons are only visible when needed. This scrolling button style can be used for example on Application Menu to enable scrolling of list of most recently used files.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.IncrementalSizing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether gallery is using incremental sizing when stretched. Default value is true. Incremental sizing will resize the width of the gallery so it fits completely the items it can contain in available space. That means that gallery will occupy enough space to display the whole items within available space. When set to false, it indicates that gallery will resize to fill all available space.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.StretchGallery
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Gallery width is determined based on the RibbonBar width. This property is in effect when Gallery is hosted directly the RibbonBar control. Default value is false. When set to true the Gallery size is changed as the RibbonBar control is resized. The initial size of the Gallery is determined by DefaultSize property. The MinimumSize property specifies the minimum size of the Gallery. Note that only single Gallery can be stretched per RibbonBar control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.PopupGalleryItems
member.summary: Gets the collection of the items that are added to the popup gallery. The items displayed on the gallery are combined with the items from this collection and they are displayed on the gallery popup. This collection can for example have items that are customizing the choices of the commands in gallery etc.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.DefaultSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default size of the gallery. The gallery height will be always enforced so all scroll buttons can be displayed. Gallery width should allow display of both scroll buttons and the gallery content.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.PopupGallerySize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default size of the gallery when gallery is displayed on the popup menu.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.EnableGalleryPopup
member.summary: Gets or sets whether gallery can be displayed on the popup. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item is expanded or not. For Popup items this would indicate whether the item is popped up or not.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.IsGalleryPopupOpen
member.summary: Gets whether the Gallery popup is open.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.KeyTips
member.summary: Gets or sets the Key Tips access key or keys for the item when on Ribbon Control or Ribbon Bar. Use KeyTips property when you want to assign the one or more letters to be used to access an item. For example assigning the FN to KeyTips property will require the user to press F then N keys to select an item. Pressing the F letter will show only keytips for the items that start with letter F.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.ScrollAnimation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether scroll animation is enabled. Default value is true. Scroll animation will be disabled if gallery is running under Remote Windows Terminal session or fade animation effect is disabled on the container control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.GalleryGroups
member.summary: Gets the collection of GalleryGroup objects associated with this gallery. Groups are assigned optionally to one or more items that are part of the GalleryContainer. Groups are used to visually group the items when gallery is displayed on the popup.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Accessible name for the Dialog Launcher button

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.BackgroundMouseOverStyle
member.summary: Specifies the background style of the control when mouse is over the control. Style specified here will be applied to the BackgroundStyle.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.DialogLauncherButton
member.summary: Gets or sets image that is used as dialog luncher button in ribbon title bar. Default value is null which indicates that default appearance for the button is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.DialogLauncherMouseOverButton
member.summary: Gets or sets image that is used as dialog luncher button when mouse is over the button. Note that if this property is set you also must set the DialogLauncherButton property. Images set to both properties must have same size. Default value is null which indicates that default appearance for the button is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.MaximumOverflowTextLength
member.summary: Gets or sets maximum text length for automatic overflow button text. When overflow button is created due to the reduced size of the control text for the button can be specified using OverflowButtonText property. If text is not specified RibbonBar.Text property is used as overflow button text. In that case this property specifies maximum length of the text to display on the button. Default value is 25. You can set this property to 0 to use complete text regardless of length.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.ResizeOrderIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets resize order index of the control. When control is parented to RibbonPanel control (which is the case when control is used as part of RibbonControl) index specified here indicates the order in which controls that are part of the same panel are resized. Lower index value indicates that control should be resized later when size needs to be reduced or earlier when size needs to be increased. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.AutoOverflowEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether automatic overflow handling is enabled. When overflow is enabled if control is resized below the size that is needed to display its complete content overflow button is created and all content is moved to the overflow button popup. Control will only display overflow button when in this state and user can click overflow button to display the actual content of the control. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.OverflowButtonText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text for overflow button that is created when ribbon bar size is reduced so it cannot display all its content. When control is resized so it cannot display its content overflow button is created which is displayed on face of the control. Complete content of the control is then displayed on popup toolbar when user clicks overflow button.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.OverflowButtonImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the Image for overflow button that is created when ribbon bar size is reduced so it cannot display all its content. When control is resized so it cannot display its content overflow button is created which is displayed on face of the control. Complete content of the control is then displayed on popup toolbar when user clicks overflow button. This Image is also used when RibbonBar is added to the Quick Access Toolbar to identify the RibbonBar button.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.DialogLauncherVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether dialog launcher button is visible in title of the ribbon. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.LayoutOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets default layout orientation inside the control. You can have multiple layouts inside of the control by adding one or more instances of the ItemContainer object and changing it's LayoutOrientation property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.ItemSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets spacing in pixels between items. Default value is 1.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.ResizeItemsToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items contained by container are resized to fit the container bounds. When container is in horizontal layout mode then all items will have the same height. When container is in vertical layout mode then all items will have the same width. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.HorizontalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item alignment when container is in horizontal layout. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.VerticalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item vertical alignment. Default value is Top.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.BeforeAddItemToQuickAccessToolbar
member.summary: Occurs before an item is added to the quick access toolbar as result of user action. This event provides ability to cancel the addition of the item by setting the Cancel=true of event arguments.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.BeforeRemoveItemFromQuickAccessToolbar
member.summary: Occurs before an item is removed from the quick access toolbar as result of user action. This event provides ability to cancel the addition of the item by setting the Cancel=true of event arguments.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.LocalizeString
member.summary: Occurs when DotNetBar is looking for translated text for one of the internal text that are displayed on menus, toolbars and customize forms. You need to set Handled=true if you want your custom text to be used instead of the built-in system value.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.ItemClick
member.summary: Occurs when Item on ribbon tab strip or quick access toolbar is clicked.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.BeforeQatCustomizeDialog
member.summary: Occurs before Quick Access Toolbar dialog is displayed. This event provides the opportunity to cancel the showing of built-in dialog and display custom customization dialog. You can also set the Dialog property of the event arguments to the custom dialog you want used instead of the DotNetBar system customization dialog.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AfterQatCustomizeDialog
member.summary: Occurs after the Quick Access Toolbar dialog is closed.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AfterQatDialogChangesApplied

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AfterRibbonPanelPopup
member.summary: Occurs after selected RibbonPanel is displayed on popup while ribbon is collapsed.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.BeforeRibbonPanelPopupClose

member.summary: Occurs after RibbonPanel popup is closed.

member.summary: Occurs after Expanded property has changed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.QatFrequentCommands
member.summary: Gets the collection of the Quick Access Toolbar Frequently used commands. You should add existing buttons to this collection that you already have on the RibbonBar controls or on the application menu. The list will be used to construct the frequently used menu that is displayed when Customize Quick Access Toolbar menu is displayed and it allows end-user to remove and add these frequently used commands to the QAT directly from this menu. Note that items you add here should not be items that are already on Quick Access Toolbar, i.e. in RibbonControl.QuickToolbarItems collection.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.KeyTipsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether KeyTips functionality is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AllowMerge
member.summary: Gets or sets whether merge functionality is enabled for the control. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AutoSize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control height is set automatically based on the content. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether anti-alias smoothing is used while painting. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.GlobalContextMenuBar
member.summary: Gets or sets the Context menu bar associated with the this control which is used as part of Global Items feature. The context menu bar assigned here will be used to search for the items with the same Name or GlobalName property so global properties can be propagated when changed. You should assign this property to enable the Global Items feature to reach your ContextMenuBar.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CaptionVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether custom caption and quick access toolbar provided by the control is visible. Default value is false. This property should be set to true when control is used on Office2007RibbonForm.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CaptionFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font for the form caption text when CaptionVisible=true. Default value is NULL which means that system font is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CaptionHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the explicit height of the caption provided by control. Caption height when set is composed of the TabGroupHeight and the value specified here. Default value is 0 which means that system default caption size is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.RibbonStripIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent of the ribbon strip. The indent setting is useful when control is used with caption visible and the Office 2007 style start button. The indent specified here will move the ribbon strip so the start button does not overlap the tabs. Value of this property is used only when CaptionVisible = true. Default value is 46.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.RibbonStripFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font used by the ribbon strip.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.FadeEffect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether mouse over fade effect is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.KeyTipsFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font that is used to display Key Tips (accelerator keys) when they are displayed. Default value is null which means that control Font is used for Key Tips display.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabGroups
member.summary: Collection of RibbonTabItemGroup items. Groups are assigned optionally to one or more RibbonTabItem object through the RibbonTabItem.Group property to visually group tabs that belong to same functions. These tabs should be positioned next to each other.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabGroupHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels of tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned. Default value is 10 pixels. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabGroupsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned is visible. Default value is false. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true. Use TabGroupHeight property to control height of the group line.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.DefaultGroupFont
member.summary: Gets or sets default font for tab groups. This font will be used if font is not specified by group style element.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.BackgroundStyle
member.summary: Specifies the background style of the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.SelectedRibbonTabItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the currently selected RibbonTabItem. RibbonTabItems are selected using the Checked property. Only a single RibbonTabItem can be selected (Checked) at any given time.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.RibbonStrip
member.summary: Returns reference to internal ribbon strip control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.Items
member.summary: Returns collection of items on a bar.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.QuickToolbarItems
member.summary: Returns collection of quick toolbar access and caption items.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.Style
member.summary: Gets/Sets the visual style of the control. If you are changing style to Office 2007 or Office 2010 use RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeStyle method instead to ensure all controls are switched properly.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AutoUpdatePadding
member.summary: Indicates whether control automatically updates Padding property for the ribbon and RibbonPanel based on style. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.Office2007ColorTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the Office 2007 Renderer global Color Table. Setting this property will affect all controls on the form that are using Office 2007 global renderer.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.IsPopupMode
member.summary: Gets whether collapsed ribbon is displaying the selected ribbon panel as popup.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.MouseWheelTabScrollEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether mouse wheel scrolls through the ribbon tabs. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control is expanded or not. When control is expanded both the tabs and the tab ribbons are visible. When collapsed only tabs are visible.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AutoExpand
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control is collapsed when RibbonTabItem is double clicked and expanded when RibbonTabItem is clicked. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AutoKeyboardExpand
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control is collapsed/expanded when Ctrl+F1 key is clicked. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.Images
member.summary: ImageList for images used on Items. Images specified here will always be used on menu-items and are by default used on all Bars.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.ImagesMedium
member.summary: ImageList for medium-sized images used on Items.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.ImagesLarge
member.summary: ImageList for large-sized images used on Items.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabStop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can give the focus to this control using the TAB key. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.BackgroundImagePosition
member.summary: Indicates the position of the BackgroundImage

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.MdiSystemItemVisible
member.summary: Specifies whether the MDI system buttons are displayed in ribbon strip when MDI Child window is maximized.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CanSupportGlass
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Ribbon control employs the Windows Vista Glass support when available. This is managed automatically by Ribbon Control and no setting is necessary on your part.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.QuickAccessToolbarBelowRibbonHeight
member.summary: Indicates Quick Access Toolbar height when positioned below the Ribbon. Default value of 0 indicates auto-height.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CanCustomize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control can be customized and items added by end-user using context menu to the quick access toolbar. Caption of the control must be visible for customization to be enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.UseExternalCustomization
member.summary: Gets or sets whether external implementation for ribbon bar and menu item customization will be used for customizing the ribbon control. When set to true it enables the displaying of RibbonBar and menu item context menus which allow customization. You are responsible for adding the menu items to context menu to handle all aspects of item customization. See "Ribbon Control Quick Access Toolbar Customization" topic in help file under How To. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.EnableQatPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets whether end-user customization of the placement of the Quick Access Toolbar is enabled. User can change the position of the Quick Access Toolbar using the customize menu. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.UseCustomizeDialog
member.summary: Gets or sets whether customize dialog is used to customize the quick access toolbar. You can handle the EnterCustomize event to display your custom dialog instead of built-in dialog for customization. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CategorizeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the categorization mode for the items on Quick Access Toolbar customize dialog box. Default value categorizes items by the ribbon bar they appear on.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.QatPositionedBelowRibbon
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Quick Access toolbar is positioned below the ribbon.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.QatLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the Quick Access Toolbar layout description. You can use the value obtained from this property to save the customized Quick Access Toolbar into registry or into any other storage object. You can also set the saved layout description back to restore user customize layout.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.QatLayoutChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Quick Access Toolbar has been customized by end-user. You can use value of this property to determine whether Quick Access Toolbar layout that can be accessed using QatLayout property should be saved.

member.summary: Applies default gray color scheme to background and title.

member.summary: Applies orange color scheme to background and title.

member.summary: Apply Office 2003 color scheme to background and title.

member.summary: Applies Office 2003 color scheme to ribbon control background.

member.summary: Applies Gray color scheme to ribbon control background.

member.summary: Applies Office 2007 Luna blue color scheme to the Ribbon Bar.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.SetRibbonControlStyle(DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl,DevComponents.DotNetBar.eDotNetBarStyle)
member.summary: Applies specified style to Ribbon control and all other controls that are managed by the ribbon control. This method is useful for example when switching the color tables for Office 2007 renderer. Once the GlobalManager.Renderer color table is changed you can call this method to apply color table changes to the Ribbon Control and other controls managed by it.
member.param: RibbonControl to set the style on.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.SetRibbonBarStyle(DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar,DevComponents.DotNetBar.eDotNetBarStyle)
member.summary: Applies specified visual style to the RibbonBar control.
member.param: RibbonBar control to set the style on.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.SetupFileMenuContainer(DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer)
member.summary: Applies current color scheme and layout settings to the container which acts as top-level file menu container. Applies to Office 2007 style only.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.SetupTwoColumnMenuContainer(DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer)
member.summary: Applies current color scheme and layout properties to the two column menu container used by the top-level file menu. Applies to Office 2007 style only.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.SetupMenuColumnOneContainer(DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer)
member.summary: Applies current color scheme and layout properties to the first column menu container used by the top-level file menu. This column usually contains menu items. Applies to Office 2007 style only.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.SetupMenuColumnTwoContainer(DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer)
member.summary: Applies current color scheme and layout properties to the first column menu container used by the top-level file menu. This column usually contains most recently used list of files or documents. Applies to Office 2007 style only.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.SetupMenuBottomContainer(DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer)
member.summary: Applies current color scheme and layout properties to the bottom menu container used by the top-level file menu. This container usually contains Options and Exit buttons. Applies to Office 2007 style only.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2007ColorTable(DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2007ColorScheme)
member.summary: Changes the Office 2007 color table for all DotNetBar controls on the open forms that are tracked by Application.OpenForms collection. You can use this function for example to apply Black color scheme to all DotNetBar control on all open forms. The color table will be changed only for controls that have Office 2007 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Color table to select and apply.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ApplyOffice2007ColorTable
member.summary: Applies current Office 2007 style color table set on GlobalManager.Renderer to all DotNetBar controls with Office 2007 style on all open forms.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2007ColorTable(System.Windows.Forms.Control,DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2007ColorScheme)
member.summary: Changes the Office 2007 color table for all DotNetBar controls on the form. You can use this function for example to apply Black color scheme to all DotNetBar control on given form. The color table will be changed only for controls that have Office 2007 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Form to apply color table to.
Color table to select and apply.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2007ColorTable(System.Windows.Forms.Control,DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2007ColorScheme,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Generates and Changes the Office 2007 color table for all DotNetBar controls on the form. You can use this function for example to create custom color scheme based on the base color and apply it to all DotNetBar control on given form. The new color table will be applied only to controls that have Office 2007 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Form to apply color table to.
Base color table to use for creation of custom color table that will be applied.
Base color used to create custom color table.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2007ColorTable(DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2007ColorScheme,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Generates and Changes the Office 2007 color table for all DotNetBar controls on all open forms. You can use this function for example to create custom color scheme based on the base color and apply it to all DotNetBar control on given form. The new color table will be applied only to controls that have Office 2007 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Base color table to use for creation of custom color table that will be applied.
Base color used to create custom color table.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ApplyOffice2007ColorTable(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Applies current Office 2007 style color table to all DotNetBar controls on the form.
member.param: Reference to the form or parent control that contains DotNetBar controls you would like to apply color table to.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeStyle(DevComponents.DotNetBar.eDotNetBarStyle)
member.summary: Changes style for all controls on Application.OpenForms to specified style. Use this method to change the style for all controls to Office 2007 or Office 2010 styles only.
member.param: New style to assign to controls on forms.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeStyle(DevComponents.DotNetBar.eDotNetBarStyle,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Changes style for all controls on Application.OpenForms to specified style. Use this method to change the style for all controls to Office 2007 or Office 2010 styles only.
member.param: New style to assign to controls on forms.
Color used to blend with the base color scheme.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2010ColorTable(System.Windows.Forms.Control,DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2010ColorScheme)
member.summary: Changes the Office 2010 color table for all DotNetBar controls on the form. You can use this function for example to apply Black color scheme to all DotNetBar control on given form. The color table will be changed only for controls that have Office 2007 and 2010 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Form to apply color table to.
Color table to select and apply.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2010ColorTable(System.Windows.Forms.Control,DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2010ColorScheme,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Generates and Changes the Office 2010 color table for all DotNetBar controls on the form. You can use this function for example to create custom color scheme based on the base color and apply it to all DotNetBar control on given form. The new color table will be applied only to controls that have Office 2007 and 2010 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Form to apply color table to.
Base color table to use for creation of custom color table that will be applied.
Base color used to create custom color table.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.CaptionHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the explicit height of the caption provided by control. Caption height when set is composed of the TabGroupHeight and the value specified here. Default value is 0 which means that system default caption size is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.CaptionVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether custom caption line provided by the control is visible. Default value is false. This property should be set to true when control is used on Office2007RibbonForm.

member.summary: Gets or sets the font for the form caption text when CaptionVisible=true. Default value is NULL which means that system font is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.RibbonStripIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent of the ribbon strip. The indent setting is useful when control is used with caption visible and the Office 2007 style start button. The indent specified here will move the ribbon strip so the start button does not overlap the tabs. Value of this property is used only when CaptionVisible = true. Default value is 46.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.TabGroupHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels of tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned. Default value is 14 pixels. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.TabGroupsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned is visible. Default value is false. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true. Use TabGroupHeight property to control height of the group line.

member.summary: Collection of RibbonTabItemGroup items. Groups are assigned optionally to one or more RibbonTabItem object through the RibbonTabItem.Group property to visually group tabs that belong to same functions. These tabs should be positioned next to each other.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonTabItem.AutoExpandOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-expand when clicked. When item is on top level bar and not on menu and contains sub-items, sub-items will be shown only if user click the expand part of the button. Setting this propert to true will expand the button and show sub-items when user clicks anywhere inside of the button. Default value is false which indicates that button is expanded only if its expand part is clicked.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Key Tips access key or keys for the item when on Ribbon Control or Ribbon Bar. Use KeyTips property when you want to assign the one or more letters to be used to access an item. For example assigning the FN to KeyTips property will require the user to press F then N keys to select an item. Pressing the F letter will show only keytips for the items that start with letter F.

member.summary: Resets Hoover timer.

member.summary: Occurs just before tooltip is displayed and gives you opportunity to cancel showing of tooltip.

member.summary: Occurs after tooltip has been closed.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.MarkupLinkClick
member.summary: Occurs when text markup link is clicked. Markup links can be created using "a" tag, for example: Markup link

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.MaximumWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum width of the super tooltip. Default value is 0 which indicates that maximum width is not used. The maximum width property will not be used if custom size is specified.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.IgnoreFormActiveState
member.summary: Gets or sets whether form active state is ignored when control is deciding whether to show tooltip. By default this property is set to false which indicates that tooltip will be shown only if parent form is active. When set to true the form active state is ignored when deciding whether to show tooltip.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.AntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether anti-alias smoothing is used while painting. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SuperTooltip will be shown for the controls assigned to it. Default value is true. You can set this property to false to disable SuperTooltip for all controls assigned to it.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.ShowTooltipImmediately
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tooltip is shown immediately after the mouse enters the control. The default value is false which indicates that tooltip is shown after system hover timeout has expired which provides slight delay before tooltip is shown.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.MinimumTooltipSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum tooltip size. Default value is 150 width and 24 height.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.TooltipDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration in seconds that tooltip is kept on screen after it is displayed. Default value is 20 seconds. You can set this value to 0 to keep tooltip displayed until user moves mouse out of control or application loses focus.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.DelayTooltipHideDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay time for hiding the tooltip in milliseconds after mouse has left the control. Default value is 0 which means that tooltip will be hidden as soon as mouse leaves the control tooltip was displayed for. You can use this property to provide the user with enough time to move the mouse cursor to the tooltip so user can act on the content of the tooltip, like hyper links.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.CheckOnScreenPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tooltip position is checked before tooltip is displayed and adjusted to tooltip always falls into screen bounds. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.CheckTooltipPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tooltip position is checked before tooltip is displayed and adjusted so tooltip does not overlaps the control it is displayed for. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.PositionBelowControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the tooltip position in relationship to the control tooltip is providing information for. Set this property to false if you want tooltip to be displayed below the mouse cursor. Default value is true which indicates that tooltip is displayed below mouse cursor but it is positioned below the control that it provides the information for so it is not covering its content.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.DefaultTooltipSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets default setting for new Tooltips you create in design time. If all your tooltips have common elements you can change this property to reflect these default setting before you start writing tooltips for all controls on the form. As you start creating new tooltips for controls on the form default values specified here will be used as starting values for new tooltip you are creating.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.DefaultSuperTooltipInfo
member.summary: Returns instance of default tooltip information used in design-time.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.SuperTooltipInfoTable
member.summary: Gets the reference to internal Hashtable that contains reference to all controls and assigned SuperTooltips. This collection must not be modified directly and it is automatically managed by the SuperTooltip component. You can use it for example to change the color for all SuperTooltips managed by the component but you should not add or remove items to it. Instead use SetSuperTooltip methods to add or remove the tooltip for a component.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.HoverDelayMultiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets the hover delay multiplier which controls how fast tooltip appears. The value set here indicates how many hover events are needed to occur before the tooltip is displayed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.IsTooltipVisible
member.summary: Returns whether tooltip is visible.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.SuperTooltipControl
member.summary: Gets reference to instance of tooltip control if any has been created at the time call is made.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.DefaultFont
member.summary: Gets or sets default tooltip font. Default value is null which means that default system font is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.ShowTooltipDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets whether complete tooltip is shown including header, body and footer. Default value is true. When set to false only tooltip header will be shown. Providing this option to your end users as part of your application setting allows them to customize the level of information displayed and reduce it after they are familiar with your product.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.ShowTooltipForFocusedControl
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tooltip is shown when control that tooltip is assigned to is focused. You can set this value to false to disable Tooltip display when control receives input focus. Default value is true.
member.remarks: This property is effective only when Super Tooltip is assigned to the controls that inherit from System.Windows.Forms.Control class and it relies on Focused property of respective control for proper function.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ScrollBarAdv.LargeChange
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to be added to or subtracted from the Value property when the scroll box is moved a large distance. A numeric value. The default value is 10. ArgumentOutOfRangeException is raised if assigned value is less than 0.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ScrollBarAdv.Maximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper limit of values of the scrollable range. A numeric value. The default value is 100.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ScrollBarAdv.Minimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower limit of values of the scrollable range. A numeric value. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ScrollBarAdv.SmallChange
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to be added to or subtracted from the Value property when the scroll box is moved a small distance. A numeric value. The default value is 1. ArgumentOutOfRangeException is raised if assigned value is less than 0.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ScrollBarAdv.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets a numeric value that represents the current position of the scroll box on the scroll bar control. A numeric value that is within the Minimum and Maximum range. The default value is 0. ArgumentOutOfRangeException is raised if assigned value is less than the Minimum property value or assigned value is greater than the Maximum property value.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SideBar.ToolTipShowing
member.summary: Occurs before tooltip for an item is shown. Sender could be the BaseItem or derived class for which tooltip is being displayed or it could be a ToolTip object itself it tooltip is not displayed for any item in particular.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SideBar.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SideBar.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrive any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SideBar.RenderMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the redering mode used by control. Default value is eRenderMode.Global which means that static GlobalManager.Renderer is used. If set to Custom then Renderer property must also be set to the custom renderer that will be used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SideBar.Renderer
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom renderer used by the items on this control. RenderMode property must also be set to eRenderMode.Custom in order renderer specified here to be used.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether flat side bar is using system colors.

member.summary: Specifes whether end-user can reorder the tabs.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.AutoCloseTabs
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab is automatically closed when close button is clicked. Closing the tab will remove tab being closed from Tabs collection and it will remove the panel as well. Default value is false which means that tab will not be closed and you should handle TabClose event to perform desired action as result of user closing the tab.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Close button that closes the active tab is visible on system box.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonOnTabsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button is visible on each tab instead of in system box.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonOnTabsAlwaysDisplayed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button on tabs when visible is displayed for every tab state. Default value is true. When set to false the close button will be displayed only for selected and tab that mouse is currently over.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the close button displayed on each tab. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.TabCloseButtonNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets custom image that is used on tabs as Close button that allows user to close the tab. Use TabCloseButtonHot property to specify image that is used when mouse is over the close button. Note that image size must be same for both images. Default value is null which means that internal representation of close button is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.TabCloseButtonHot
member.summary: Gets or sets custom image that is used on tabs as Close button whem mouse is over the close button. To use this property you must set TabCloseButtonNormal as well. Note that image size for both images must be same. Default value is null which means that internal representation of close button is used.

member.name: T:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ToastNotification
member.summary: Represents class used to display toast notifications. A toast notification is a message that appears on the surface of the screen for a moment, but it does not take focus (or pause the current activity), so it cannot accept any user input. Notification pops up on the surface of the specified Form or Control. It only fills the amount of space required for the message and the user's current activity remains visible and interactive. The notification automatically fades in and out after specified time interval. Notification text supports text-markup.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ToastNotification.Close(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Closes all toast notifications open on specified parent control.

member.summary: Closes specified toast notification on parent control.
member.param: Toast ID as returned by the Show method.

member.summary: Updates the already displayed toast text. Note that toast notification will not be resized.
member.param: Parent control which was used to show toast.
Toast ID returned by the Show toast method.

member.summary: Displays the toast notification on top of the specified parent control, we recommend always using a parent form.
member.param: Parent form to display toast notification on top of
Image to display next to toast text.
Interval in milliseconds after which the notification is hidden.
Specifies the position of the toast notification.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Highlighter component that is used to highlight validation errors.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Validator.SuperValidator.ValidationType
member.summary: Gets or sets the validation type performed by the control. Default value is Manual.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Validator.SuperValidator.ContainerControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the container control validator is bound to. The container control must be set for the ValidationType ValidatingEventOnContainer. When ContainerControl is Form the validator handles the Closing event of the form to perform the validation and cancel the form closing. You can disable that by setting either Enabled=false or Form.CausesValidation=false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Validator.SuperValidator.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether validation is performed. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Validator.SuperValidator.CancelValidatingOnControl
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Cancel argument in Validating event for validation type ValidatingEventPerControl is set to true when validation fails.

member.name: T:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Validator.eValidationType
member.summary: Specifies the validation type for SuperValidator control.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Validator.eValidationType.Manual
member.summary: SuperValidator uses manual validation, i.e. you will call Validate method to perform validation.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Validator.eValidationType.ValidatingEventPerControl
member.summary: Validation is performed per control from each controls Validating event. The Cancel is set to true on event arguments if validation fails.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Validator.eValidationType.ValidatingEventOnContainer
member.summary: Validation is performed for all controls from Validating event on container control. By default container control is Form that SuperValidator is on.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.GetWindowPlacement(System.IntPtr,DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WINDOWPLACEMENT@)
member.summary: Retrieves the show state and the restored, minimized, and maximized positions of the specified window.
member.param:
A pointer to the WINDOWPLACEMENT structure that receives the show state and position information.
Before calling GetWindowPlacement, set the length member to sizeof(WINDOWPLACEMENT). GetWindowPlacement fails if lpwndpl-> length is not set correctly.
member.returns:
If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: T:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions
member.summary: Options available when a form is tested for mose positions.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.Error
member.summary: HTERROR: On the screen background or on a dividing line between windows (same as HTNOWHERE, except that the DefWindowProc function produces a system beep to indicate an error).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.TransparentOrCovered
member.summary: HTTRANSPARENT: In a window currently covered by another window in the same thread (the message will be sent to underlying windows in the same thread until one of them returns a code that is not HTTRANSPARENT).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.NoWhere
member.summary: HTNOWHERE: On the screen background or on a dividing line between windows.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.ClientArea
member.summary: HTCLIENT: In a client area.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.TitleBar
member.summary: HTCAPTION: In a title bar.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.SystemMenu
member.summary: HTSYSMENU: In a window menu or in a Close button in a child window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.GrowBox
member.summary: HTGROWBOX: In a size box (same as HTSIZE).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.Menu
member.summary: HTMENU: In a menu.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.HorizontalScrollBar
member.summary: HTHSCROLL: In a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.VerticalScrollBar
member.summary: HTVSCROLL: In the vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.MinimizeButton
member.summary: HTMINBUTTON: In a Minimize button.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.MaximizeButton
member.summary: HTMAXBUTTON: In a Maximize button.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.LeftSizeableBorder
member.summary: HTLEFT: In the left border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window horizontally).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.RightSizeableBorder
member.summary: HTRIGHT: In the right border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window horizontally).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.TopSizeableBorder
member.summary: HTTOP: In the upper-horizontal border of a window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.TopLeftSizeableCorner
member.summary: HTTOPLEFT: In the upper-left corner of a window border.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.BottomSizeableBorder
member.summary: HTBOTTOM: In the lower-horizontal border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window vertically).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.BottomLeftSizeableCorner
member.summary: HTBOTTOMLEFT: In the lower-left corner of a border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window diagonally).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.BottomRightSizeableCorner
member.summary: HTBOTTOMRIGHT: In the lower-right corner of a border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window diagonally).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.NonSizableBorder
member.summary: HTBORDER: In the border of a window that does not have a sizing border.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Hide
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Normal
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowMinimized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Maximize
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowMaximized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowNoActivate
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to , except the window is not actived.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Show
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Minimize
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowMinNoActive
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Restore
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowDefault
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_* value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ForceMinimize
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Wizard.PagesHistory
member.summary: Returns a Stack of page history. Each time next page is displayed by wizard, previously visited page is added to the history. When user commands Wizard back, the last page from the history is shown and removed from the stack. You should not modify this collection directly since it is maintained by Wizard control.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether page is interior page. Interior pages use wizard header area to display page title, description and optional image. They are also padded and do not fill the client area of the Wizard. Default value is true. You can set this value to false to hide header area and make page fill the client area of the wizard.
